name: G3 Outdoor Training Frog Suit Physical Fitness Uniform
description: item: value. Product Type: uniform. Fabric Type: 65%polyester 35%cotton.
specifications: 7 days sample order lead time: Support

details.description: Description Produit Paramoter item value Product Type uniform Fabric Type 65%polyester 35%cotton 7 days sample order lead time Support Supply Type OEM service Style Multicam camouflage or customized Feature Anti-Static, Breathable, Flame-Retardant, Rip-Stop Place of Origin China, Hubei Brand Corhunter Application Military, Outdoor Working, Hunting Delivery Time Quantity based Package 1 Set/polybag Season four season Features **Technical Challenges of Frog Suit Color Matching** The frog suit is an important piece of equipment for soldiers when performing missions, and its color matching is crucial to the soldier's concealment. However, there are many technical challenges in the process of color matching of frog suits. This article will discuss these challenges, mainly including environmental adaptability, color accuracy, material impact, changes in lighting conditions, color matching design, user psychological perception, technical implementation difficulty and cost control requirements. 1. Environmental adaptability: Different terrains and environments have different requirements for the color of frog suits. For example, a forest environment may require a dark green or tan frog suit, while a desert environment may require an earthy or light brown frog suit. Therefore, the color of the frog suit must be able to adapt to various complex and changing environments, which is a major technical challenge. 2. Color accuracy: Color accuracy is crucial to the concealment of a frog suit. Slight color deviations may cause soldiers to be detected while concealed. Therefore, how to ensure the accuracy and consistency of frog suit colors is another important technical challenge. 3. Material influence: The material of the frog suit also has a great influence on the color presentation. Different materials may have different effects on color absorption, reflection and scattering, thus affecting the color matching of the frog suit. Therefore, when choosing frog clothing materials, you need to fully consider its impact on color. 4. Changes in lighting conditions: Changes in lighting conditions will also affect the color of the frog suit. The same color may appear differently under different lighting conditions. Therefore, how to make the color of the frog suit highly match the surrounding environment under different lighting conditions is a challenging technical problem. 5. Color matching design: In addition to basic color matching, color matching design is also an important technical challenge. How to make the frog suit more consistent with the surrounding environment through reasonable color matching and improve the concealment of soldiers requires designers to conduct in-depth research and practice. 6. User psychological perception: User psychological perception is also a factor that cannot be ignored. The soldier's acceptance and psychological perception of the color of the frog suit will directly affect its effectiveness. Therefore, in the process of color matching of frog uniforms, the psychological needs and perceptual characteristics of soldiers need to be fully considered. 7. Difficulty of technical implementation: Frog suit color matching involves knowledge and technology in multiple fields, such as color science, material science, environmental science, etc. How to achieve effective integration and optimization of these technologies to meet the needs of frog suit color matching is a very difficult technical issue. 8. Cost control requirements: While meeting the above technical challenges, cost control requirements also need to be considered. How to reduce costs while ensuring the quality of frog suits and make them more suitable for mass production and application is an important issue that needs to be solved in the color matching process of frog suits. To sum up, frog suit color matching faces many technical challenges. In order to overcome these challenges, factors such as environmental adaptability, color accuracy, material influence, changes in lighting conditions, color matching design, user psychological perception, technical implementation difficulty and cost control requirements need to be comprehensively considered, and effective measures and technical means must be adopted. solve. Products application 01 It is not a suitable uniform for any occasion, and in some cases, if other uniforms are more suitable, the BDU cannot be worn. When on duty, the commander will clearly specify whether to wear the BDU; in leisure time, unless specifically requested by the commander, the BDU should not be worn. BDU is not allowed for travel or normal personal flow, except for travel from residence to post. BDU is also not allowed to be worn on aircraft, unless it is a group action of a military nature. In addition, BDU cannot be worn in the context of the sale of alcoholic beverages. BDU is a C-class uniform (combat uniform), which is a more formal task attire. On duty, the field commander will clearly specify to wear a C-class uniform. Class C uniforms are uniforms with a clear mission orientation and cannot be worn at ordinary times. This type of uniform is usually designed to be looser, and the wearer is not allowed to change it to fit or tighten without authorization, because this will reduce the air flow in the clothes and reduce the ventilation and heat dissipation ability of the clothes. 02 When wearing a C-class uniform, it is stipulated that the coat must be worn over the pants, and the pants must be tied with a belt. The trousers must be tightened. If there is no elastic band in the trousers themselves, the legs must be tied or the trousers must be securely tied inside the high-top boots. The trousers must be loose and not attached to the legs, making the legs look like long nails. Only on some special occasions, such as military parades, inspections by superiors, celebrations, etc., when the dress is required to show a fresh and capable style, the on-site commander can ask the soldiers to tie the uniform tightly. Generally, the C-class uniform can only be worn with black high-top leather boots. Other equipment, such as equipment belts, water bottles, hook belts, etc., need to be ordered by the on-site commander, and all personnel must load or unload them uniformly. Heavy combat equipment (military police equipment) loaded on the BDU should only be worn collectively during combat missions and must be authorized by the field commander. If the sleeves need to be rolled up, the sleeves should be rolled up above the elbow, but not 3 inches (7.5cm) above the elbow, and the camouflage surface must be kept outside. 03 Summer uniforms and other seasonal uniforms cannot be worn together. In some special circumstances, such as high-intensity training, manual labor or climatic reasons, the commander may order that the coat is not to be worn for the time being. The BDU Army-style BDU patrol hat of the US Army is the basic hat of the BDU. The "pointed" hat of the Marine Corps style with jungle camouflage pattern is not allowed to be worn with the BDU at any time. Wear the BDU patrol hat must be worn straight. The brim line around the head should be parallel to the ground, and the forehead should not show hair. It is not an occasion for formation ceremonies. If the weather is cold, the commander can allow soldiers to wear earmuffs under the hat. Wearing a BDU patrol hat cannot put things inside or turn it over. Authorization to wear the organization's emblem beret in conjunction with the BDU has yet to be confirmed at the top. Official officers' hats have bright rank badges; recruits' rank badges have a soft gloss. Soldiers can wear summer fabric uniforms or regular fabrics without special designation. Soldiers can wear black leather gloves while wearing their uniforms in cold weather if they don't have a coat to keep out the cold, but the sleeves must come down and cover the gloves (there is no rule on when soldiers must wear gloves, only when they need to protect their hands from the cold). 04 A jungle camouflage winter coat can be worn with all BDUs. An all-black winter coat can be used as a raincoat, but it is better to choose a military raincoat with a jungle camouflage pattern, which is much better camouflage. When it is cold, you can wear an olive green military scarf and black leather gloves without a winter coat or designated winter coat, but if there is a winter coat, you cannot wear a scarf and gloves. The coat must be zipped tightly and buttoned. The shirt collar should be worn inside the coat, not turned out. The wearer can decide whether to wear the hood with the camouflage winter coat belt; but when not wearing it, be sure to fold it into the collar of the coat and zip it tightly. Only on non-combat duty and in the camp can women bring handbags or handbags while wearing uniform. Military uniform detail Shoulder straps can be fitted with epaulettes Stand-up lapel Large pockets on both sides Hidden button Military uniform OEM/ODM Tactical uniform supplier Tactical uniform manufacture Adjustable cuffs Army BDU all-rounder uniform The Army's "green cotton satin" uniform was once the Army's all-rounder uniform, which was designed and built to be worn in a variety of missions. In 1968, the Army's green poplin jungle uniform replaced the "green cotton satin" uniform during the Vietnam War. Shortly thereafter, soldiers participating in the Vietnam War donned green poplin uniforms with a camouflage pattern more suitable for the jungle environment. This status continued until recruitment in 1978, and by 1982, all Army troops had replaced the current jungle camouflage BDU. Camouflage pattern of BDU The camouflage pattern of the BDU includes almost all environmental options: the standard 3-color green camouflage BDU (US Army and Marine Corps); 3-color desert camouflage BDU; 6-color desert camouflage BDU (also known as "chocolate shavings"). Conventional camouflage patterns - like the US military green camouflage BDU - are designed to provide as much concealment as possible in various environmental conditions and reduce the chance of being discovered by the enemy. Some special patterns, such as bark patterns, are designed for some specific environments and may not be suitable for other places. For example, the "tiger pattern" camouflage is very familiar to everyone. It was designed during the Vietnam War (circa 1965) for US Special Forces jungle operations. It is based on the design of BDU during the British conflict in Malaysia in the earlier (1950s). Jungle camouflage (left), 3-color desert camouflage (center), the latest digital camouflage (right) The US Soldier Systems Command (SSCOM) at the Research and Development Engineering Center (NRDEC) in Knightko, Massachusetts has developed a double-sided wearable camouflage fabric with a 4-color jungle camouflage pattern on the front and a 3-color desert camouflage pattern on the reverse. In the future, double-sided fabrics with combinations of urban camouflage/desert camouflage, urban camouflage/jungle camouflage, etc. The brightness difference (contrast) between things and the background is the most fundamental for the human eye to perceive things. Therefore, light camouflage is easy to mix with rocks, sand or dead grass; light green BDU is easy to mix with shorter green grass. Pattern and shape are another of the most important visual factors, so the camouflage pattern should match the density of the background "markings": a pattern that is too large, or the color block of the camouflage is larger than the average color block of the background, it is easy to be found; conversely, if the camouflage pattern is too small, it will also cause contrasting features and be found by people. Therefore, "markings" - the frequency of the appearance and distribution of the main color block or pattern - should be consistent with the determined density of the environmental background "markings". In theory, the pattern formed by fractal graphics can match a certain environment, but still no good fractal pattern has been found, and it is still in the research stage. Products Description The BDU before the US military changed into ACU has been installed since the early 1980s. USA, USN, USMC, and USAF have no big difference in BDU styles. The military differences lie in military caps and badges. USA and USAF wear combat caps with the front and back of the hat wall. USMC and USN wear octagonal hats, and Benny hats are used by all military services. Active BDU tops are loose hem with five buttons (the collar is exposed, the rest is hidden), two box-type upper pockets, and two box-type lower pockets, all with pockets, and the upper pocket is covered by two buttons. There is a pencil case in the left chest pocket. The tops have no shoulder loops (occasionally a small number of shoulder loops). The waist loops were seen in styles before the mid-1990s. It is believed to have been cancelled in the later stage. The cuffs have elastic sleeve loops and three buttons for adjustment. Some special forces are accustomed to removing chest pockets and sewing them on the arms, removing lower pockets and sewing them diagonally on the chest, and tucking their tops into their pants during combat. In addition, the BDU pants before changing are double-sided pockets, double-hip pockets, and double-leg pockets. The side pockets are dug-up designs, and the hip pockets are dug-up designs with pockets, which are buckled with two buttons. The leg pockets are designed with pockets, and the pockets are buckled with two buttons. The pockets are fixed on the leg pockets body towards the front side of the human body. The trousers have nylon straps. Active ACUs are fixed with zippers and Velcro, and buttons are no longer used (because buttons are fragile, such as falling off). And the pencil case of the shirt is located on the sleeve of the left arm, not on the chest. The hat for the seasonal BDU and hot season BDU uniforms is a cylindrical cap with a tongue. The winter jungle camouflage coat has a thick lining to keep out the cold, which is longer in length and has slits at the back of the hem for easy movement. The collar can be erected to tighten and protect the neck and chin. There is also a folded hood inside the collar. The placket is closed with a long zipper. There are two layers of lapels, and two larger pockets in the lower position. The jungle camouflage coat features a single lapel design with four flip-top front pockets. This coat has a straight-cut hem (the width of the hem can be adjusted on both sides of the new version), and the sleeves are sewn with reinforcement layers. The jungle camouflage pants have four standard pockets, and there is also a box pocket on each side of the trouser leg. The knees and hips are also sewn with reinforcement layers. In hot season, the placket of BDU pants uses buttons instead of zippers to enhance ventilation. The waistband and trousers can be adjusted and tightened. In hot season, BDU coats and pants are made of reinforced wear-resistant pure cotton cloth with a 4-color jungle camouflage pattern. In season, BDU coats and pants are made of 50% nylon-50% cotton twill fabric, which is also a 4-color jungle camouflage pattern. Environmental adaptability: Different terrains and environments have different requirements for the color of frog suits. For example, a forest environment may require a dark green or tan frog suit, while a desert environment may require an earthy or light brown frog suit. Color accuracy: Color accuracy is crucial to the concealment of a frog suit. Slight color deviations may cause soldiers to be detected while concealed. Color matching design: In addition to basic color matching, color matching design is also an important technical challenge. Therefore, in the process of color matching of frog uniforms, the psychological needs and perceptual characteristics of soldiers need to be fully considered. 7. Difficulty of technical implementation: Frog suit color matching involves knowledge and technology in multiple fields, such as color science, material science, environmental science, etc. How to achieve effective integration and optimization of these technologies to meet the needs of frog suit color matching is a very difficult technical issue. 8. Cost control requirements: While meeting the above technical challenges, cost control requirements also need to be considered. How to reduce costs while ensuring the quality of frog suits and make them more suitable for mass production and application is an important issue that needs to be solved in the color matching process of frog suits. To sum up, frog suit color matching faces many technical challenges. This training suit was originally developed by the US military for combat in desert areas and has the functions of wicking sweat and flame retardant. To solve the problem of soldiers wicking sweat in hot environments, the US military spliced together the sleeves of the combat suit and the summer T-shirt. This modular design was later named FROG, or "frog suit". The design features of the frog suit include: Quick-drying perspiration: The torso part is made of quick-drying fabric, which can quickly discharge sweat in a high temperature environment and keep it dry. Wear-resistant: The limbs are made of wear-resistant materials, suitable for use in complex environments. Adaptability: The design of the frog suit takes into account the needs of different climates and combat environments, making it suitable for a wide range of applications. details.description: Description Products paramotor product parameters Product type M65 military jacket Fabric 65% Polyester and 35% Cotton Texture Checkered Season Autumn,winter Color fastness 4-5grade Certificate SGS,ISO Customize Fabric, style, size and label can all be customized product detail M65 jacket manufacture M65 jacket supplier M65 jacket M65 jacket M65 jacket M65 jacket The M65 jacket is a clothing item with extremely distinctive features and influence. Historical origin Origin and development: The origin of the M65 jacket can be traced back to the M-1941 field jacket during World War II. At that time, the US military took the lead in separating field coats and service uniforms to establish their own uniform systems. Later, due to problems such as the fragile texture of the M-1941 jacket, the M-1943 jacket was improved and developed, adding a storm hood design. After World War II and the outbreak of the Korean War, the US military added lining to the M-1943 jacket, forming the prototype of the M-1951 field jacket. Finally, in 1965, the M-65 field jacket was finalized and launched. Military equipment and dissemination: In 1966, the production of M65 field windbreakers began and it became the standard equipment for US troops stationed everywhere, lasting for about 40 years. With the US's foreign military aid and frequent appearances in cultural works such as movies, the M65 jacket gradually spread around the world. Design Features Appearance Design: The M65 jacket has no cumbersome decorations and the overall style is simple and tough. Its iconic feature is that there are two large pockets on the chest. The pocket openings are slightly inclined downward for easy access to items. The pocket flaps are fixed with a hidden snap. There are two 4 cm edges on the outside and bottom, making the cross-section of the "warehouse pocket" approximately triangular, so it won't look bloated when filled with things. In addition, it is equipped with an adjustable hood. The cuffs are bonded with Velcro. There is a pleat design on the back to increase hand movement space and it has shoulder epaulets, showing a hardcore military style. Fabric Selection: Generally, a fabric made of 50% cotton and 50% nylon blend is used. This fabric is strong and durable, has strong wind resistance, can also prevent light rain, and has been waterproofed. It has a certain flame retardant function and can withstand a tensile force of 100 kilograms. Detail Design: The M65 jacket adopts a snap/zipper dual-purpose placket design. The front placket uses brass zippers and brass snaps. There are adjustment drawstrings on the waist, hood and bottom for the wearer to adjust according to different environments and needs. Its double-layer shoulder seams provide a greater range of free movement for the arms. The Velcro design on the cuffs can completely cover the back of the hand and gloves, increasing warmth and practicality. Color and Style Color: Common colors include jungle green, desert yellow, tiger stripe, urban camouflage, three-color desert, black, khaki, etc. Among them, olive green is a relatively classic color. Most of the M65s produced by the US military in the early days were of this color. Later, there were also styles such as jungle camouflage. Style: In addition to the standard field jacket style, there are also some derivative styles, such as styles with liners, which can enhance thermal insulation performance. In addition, in the civilian market, some brands have also launched improved styles based on the M65 design. On the basis of retaining its classic elements, more fashion and leisure design elements are incorporated. Cultural influence Military culture: As the standard military uniform of the US military, the M65 jacket has witnessed the military actions of the US military in multiple historical periods and has become one of the important symbols of military culture. It represents the spirit of toughness, durability, and adaptability to various environments, and is deeply loved and pursued by military enthusiasts. Fashion culture: The classic design of the M65 jacket not only has influenced the development of military uniforms in various countries but also has had a huge impact on civilian clothing. Since its appearance, its shadow can be seen more or less on many men's autumn and winter clothing. Many fashion brands will also draw on the design elements of the M65 and launch clothing of similar styles. In Western countries, it is a common street clothing, widely welcomed by all social strata. It also has a high appearance rate in American movies. Many movie stars have worn the M65 jacket, further promoting its popularity in the fashion industry. details.description: Description product parameters Product type G8 tactical jacket Fabric 65% Polyester and 35% Cotton Texture Checkered Season Autumn,winter Color fastness 4-5grade Certificate SGS,ISO Customize Fabric, style, size and label can all be customized Products Brand Corhunter G8 military jacket Historical origin Military background: The G8 jacket was originally a flight jacket designed for US military pilots. During World War I, as aerial warfare gradually emerged, the US military began to design thick leather jackets that could withstand cold weather and high-altitude environments for pilots and ground crew. The G8 jacket emerged under this background. Brand development: In the 1970s, as the surplus supplies of the US government gradually decreased, the supply of pilot jackets also decreased accordingly. At this time, Jeff Clyman, a pilot, vintage flight jacket trader, and collector, began to replicate classic flight jackets such as the A-2 and G-1 under the Avirex brand. In Avirex's product catalog of the 1980s, a goatskin jacket named G8 appeared. It is said to be the style used by US Navy and Marine Corps pilots from the 1920s to the 1930s. Design Features Pocket Design: One of the most notable features of the G8 jacket is the two oversized pockets on the chest. These pockets not only have a large capacity but also have a unique design. Items can be placed vertically or taken out conveniently from the side. Usually, there are some detailed designs, such as a pencil slot in the left chest pocket, which is convenient for pilots to store flight-related items such as gloves, maps, and pencils. In terms of breaking strength: polyester fiber is the best one among synthetic fibers, and it can remain unchanged when wet. 2. The elasticity of polyester fiber is the largest among all fibers. It has high resilience and strong resistance to damage. After washing, the fabric can maintain its original appearance without distortion. 3. Polyester fiber has the same feel as wool and is suitable for blending with wool. 4. The load of polyester fiber is small, so it is suitable for finishing. 5. Polyester fiber has excellent resistance to bleaching auxiliaries. 6. Polyester fiber has strong acid resistance. 7. Polyester fiber has good electrical insulation. 8. Polyester fiber has good resistance to sunlight and climate. 9. The heat resistance of polyester fiber is the best among synthetic fibers. The starting softening temperature is 235-240 degrees Celsius, and the melting point is 255-260 degrees Celsius. 10. Low hygroscopicity, easy to wash and quick drying. 11. Strong resistance to microorganisms, no mildew or moth. Polyester fibers have particularly excellent textile properties and wear properties, and their uses are quite extensive. The story of the generation of camouflage Clever Boers change colors to win battles At the end of the 19th century, British imperialism launched an Anglo-Bulgarian War in South Africa. The Boers were a small number, one-fifth of the British. In the early days of the war, the fighting Boers suffered more casualties. The wise Boers summed up the lessons of defeat in time and carefully observed the Condition of the British army. They discovered an Achilles' heel in the British army. The British were wearing bright red uniforms, which stood out against the green of the Savannas and forests of South Africa and gave them away. Inspired by this, the Boers immediately painted their uniforms and guns grass green to blend in with the green of the jungle. So that the English were in the light, and the Boers in the dark, and the Boers could easily see the English, but the English could not see the Boers. At the same time, the British army was still arrogant and aggressive because of its large numbers. The Boers often approached the British without being seen, and when they were not aware of them, they attacked them suddenly, leaving them bewildered and unprepared. The Boers fought and hid, but the British could not find a target to return to. More than 90,000 British soldiers were killed or wounded in the war. When you browse tactical items, you'll often come across the word "tear resistant," whether they're made of NyCo or PolyCo fabric. Ripstop is the name of a textile fiber weaving technique. Most people think this knitting has something to do with preventing tears from happening. It didn't. Its job is to stop the cracks from spreading once they start. In technical terms, tear resistance prevents tearing from completely destroying the fabric's structure. A tear may begin, but it does not extend a few millimeters beyond the braided thick-reinforced yarn. This ability makes tear prevention ideal for tactical use -- especially if the wearer has a tear during surgery and can't change clothes. The story of the generation of camouflage Clever Boers change colors to win battles At the end of the 19th century, British imperialism launched an Anglo-Bulgarian War in South Africa. The Boers were a small number, one-fifth of the British. In the early days of the war, the fighting Boers suffered more casualties. The wise Boers summed up the lessons of defeat in time and carefully observed the Condition of the British army. They discovered an Achilles' heel in the British army. The British were wearing bright red uniforms, which stood out against the green of the Savannas and forests of South Africa and gave them away. Inspired by this, the Boers immediately painted their uniforms and guns grass green to blend in with the green of the jungle. So that the English were in the light, and the Boers in the dark, and the Boers could easily see the English, but the English could not see the Boers. At the same time, the British army was still arrogant and aggressive because of its large numbers. The Boers often approached the British without being seen, and when they were not aware of them, they attacked them suddenly, leaving them bewildered and unprepared. The Boers fought and hid, but the British could not find a target to return to. More than 90,000 British soldiers were killed or wounded in the war. When you browse tactical items, you'll often come across the word "tear resistant," whether they're made of NyCo or PolyCo fabric. Ripstop is the name of a textile fiber weaving technique. Most people think this knitting has something to do with preventing tears from happening. It didn't. Its job is to stop the cracks from spreading once they start. In technical terms, tear resistance prevents tearing from completely destroying the fabric's structure. A tear may begin, but it does not extend a few millimeters beyond the braided thick-reinforced yarn. This ability makes tear prevention ideal for tactical use -- especially if the wearer has a tear during surgery and can't change clothes. Fancy camouflage With the development of science and technology progress, people invented a reconnaissance equipment --, infrared detection visual instrument, with its observation can find hidden in the green trees soldiers dressed in various colors including green and can be found with the yellow land, rock suit soldiers, can also be found in the snow the soldiers dressed in white. The principle is that the infrared light reflected by the soldiers' clothes is different from that reflected by the background of the environment, so that the infrared detector can clearly spot soldiers hidden in the natural background that is difficult to see with the naked eye. In order to deal with the detection of infrared detector, people mixed some special chemical substances in the multicolor obscuration, through continuous research, make the infrared light wave reflected by these colors and the environmental background reflected by the infrared light wave consistent, so that the reflection ability of the obscuration and the natural environment background close. As a result, modern camouflage uniforms are invisible not only to the eye, but also to infrared detectors. The story of the generation of camouflage The complex combat environment forced soldiers to wear flower clothes In the First World War, the armies of various countries did not have special combat clothing, but generally fought in military uniforms. Therefore, the colors of military uniforms were gradually unified in green tones. In green tonal, have dark green, grass green, dark green and olive green to wait. Under the conditions of the time, green tones were better suited to activities and operations in jungle, grassland and farmland areas. Of course, from a hidden point of view, uniform color should not be limited to green. Be like desert, bald mountain, hill, wasteland, its background also is not green. Therefore, countries in the world choose the colors of military uniforms flexibly and reasonably according to their own local natural environment conditions. As a result, in the military uniforms of various countries, there are earthen yellow, brown, blue gray, etc., because these colors are close to the color of the earth, desert, rock; And in the snow, choose white camouflage combat uniform, in order to coordinate with the environment; On the ocean, wearing blue and white sea shirts can be integrated with the ocean. In The Second World War, the combat environment was further complicated, and a single color was easy to be found by the enemy, so, there was a multi-color deformation block composed of flower clothes. This kind of flower clothes is more suitable for hiding in the mountains and meadows of various colors. In appearance, it is similar to modern camouflage. At that time, more than 10 European and American expeditionary forces stationed around the world used combat uniforms made of 6-color camouflage in actual combat. But at that time the camouflage flower clothing is not today's camouflage clothing, because it can only confuse and deal with the naked eye that is visual observation. To enhance the durability of the fabric, a certain proportion of polyester fiber is added. The proportion of polyester fiber is about [10% - 30%]. Zippers of the clothes (if there are zipper designs, such as pocket zippers) usually adopt metal or nylon materials. Metal zippers are sturdy and durable with a textured appearance; nylon zippers are relatively lightweight and smooth. Moreover, there are anti - slip textures to increase the convenience of gripping. Knitting, on the other hand, is made up of a continuous coil, so it has a certain elasticity. As for hand feeling, it is influenced by yarn number, weaving method and finishing. But usually knitted fabrics feel softer. Underwear, sweaters and so on that we wear are examples of knitted fabrics. Our suits, shirts and jeans are woven. Summer jacket, in addition to shirts and chiffon, basically with knitted T-shirt for many, tatting generally used for coat shirt pants. Of course actually dividing line is not very clear also, knitting does some thicker also can do coat. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Size Large Material: T/C twill/plain Fabric Type: Polyester/Cotton /CVC Color: Multicam Hat Origin： Imported Feature The color of the camouflage baseball cap has an important impact on the camouflage effect. The core principle of camouflage design is to use changes in color, pattern and texture to simulate the surrounding environment to break the outline of the human body and make soldiers more visually difficult to detect. Here are some key points on how the color of a camouflage baseball cap affects camouflage: 1. Environmental matching: The color of the camouflage baseball cap usually matches the environment in which the soldier is located. For example, if a soldier is fighting in a forest, the hat might be colored in natural tones like dark green and brown to simulate forest vegetation. This color matching helps soldiers blend into the environment and reduce the chance of being detected by the enemy. 2. Light and shadow: The color of a camouflage baseball cap is also affected by light and shadow. The effect of camouflage patterns may vary under different light and shadow conditions. Therefore, when choosing camouflage colors, you need to consider the camouflage effect under different light conditions. 3. Distance and viewing angle: The camouflage effect of a camouflage baseball cap is also affected by distance and viewing angle. At close range or at certain viewing angles, camouflage patterns may be easier to spot. Therefore, camouflage design needs to take these factors into consideration to ensure that soldiers can maintain good camouflage effects at different distances and viewing angles. 4. Dynamic camouflage: In addition to static camouflage designs, some camouflage baseball caps also use dynamic camouflage technology. This technology improves soldiers' camouflage capabilities by changing the color or pattern of the hat to adapt to changes in the surrounding environment. For example, some camouflage baseball caps use special paint or fabrics that can change color according to changes in light, allowing soldiers to maintain better camouflage effects in different environments. In short, the color of a camouflage baseball cap is one of the important factors affecting its camouflage effect. Through reasonable color selection and camouflage design, soldiers' camouflage ability can be improved and the chance of being discovered by the enemy can be reduced. details.description: Description Products Description Size Large Material: T/C twill/plain Fabric Type: Polyester/Cotton /CVC Color: Multicam Hat Origin： Imported Products feature The production process of camouflage military hats mainly involves the following steps Final Design First, designers create the camouflage pattern and go through multiple revisions and optimizations until achieving a satisfactory result. This step is the foundation of the entire production process, determining the final product's appearance and quality. Pattern Making Once the design is finalized, it needs to be converted into a production-ready format. This step involves translating the design into specific pattern data, preparing for subsequent production. Printing and Dyeing At the dyeing factory, technicians use specialized equipment to sensitize and transfer the designed camouflage pattern onto the printing machine's roller or screen. Based on the different colors in the camouflage pattern, various color plates are created, and through multiple color adjustments and dyeing processes, the entire camouflage pattern is produced. This step is critical to the production process, directly affecting the clarity of the camouflage pattern and the accuracy of its colors. Cutting and Sewing After printing and dyeing, the garment factory cuts the fabric according to the paper patterns, shaping each part of the hat. The parts are then sewn together to form a complete camouflage military hat. This step requires skilled workers to ensure that the quality and appearance of the hat meet design specifications. Quality Inspection Finally, the completed camouflage military hats undergo a quality inspection to ensure that each hat meets quality standards. This step is crucial for guaranteeing product quality; through strict quality checks, unqualified products can be prevented from entering the market. Summarize The entire production process requires close cooperation and meticulous operations across multiple stages to ensure that the final product's quality and appearance meet expected standards. Additionally, for fabrics with special performance requirements (such as waterproofing or flame resistance), the printing and dyeing process may be adjusted to meet different usage needs. Produit detail Frequently Asked Questions What are the precautions for washing camouflage military caps? The washing instructions for camouflage military hats mainly include using a soft brush and neutral detergent, controlling the water temperature to not exceed 40°C, avoiding machine washing, and drying in a cool, ventilated area. **Use a Soft Brush and Neutral Detergent**: When washing, gently scrub the hat with a soft brush to avoid damaging the camouflage pattern. A neutral detergent is recommended, as strong alkaline or acidic cleaners can harm the camouflage coating and affect the hat's appearance and lifespan. **Control Water Temperature to Not Exceed 40°C**: High water temperatures can cause the camouflage coating to peel or deform, so it's important to keep the water temperature below 40°C to protect the coating. **Avoid Machine Washing**: Machine washing is strictly prohibited, as the intense agitation and friction can damage the camouflage pattern and distort the hat. Hand washing is advised for gentle care. **Dry in a Cool, Ventilated Area**: When drying, choose a dry, ventilated space away from direct sunlight to prevent fading. Avoid folding or pressing the hat to maintain its shape. Following these precautions effectively protects the appearance and longevity of the camouflage military hat while ensuring the integrity of the pattern and functionality. Later, the Basque people along the French-Spanish border adopted this hat, leading to it being known as the "Basque beret." It gradually evolved into a brimless soft military hat, commonly used as a distinctive symbol for special forces, paratroopers, and other elite units in various countries, with color differences indicating different branches. In 1889, the Alpine troops formed by the French army became the first military unit to adopt the beret as a standard military hat, abandoning the flat-topped kepi from the Napoleonic era. The soft, brimless design was advantageous for avoiding snags on branches and ensured a snug fit that wouldn't fall off while running. In 1917, during a joint training exercise between British tank troops and French mountain units, British Major General Hugh Elles noticed the distinctive hat worn by the French soldiers, which he found suitable for his tank crew. He combined it with the then-popular Scottish tam o'shanter design, creating a version specifically for British tank crews, made from wool in a practical black color to resist dirt and oil, and featuring an adjustable drawstring for a better fit. This marked the true beginning of the modern beret in military use. During World War II, the British began forming special operations units to infiltrate and disrupt the fascist-occupied European continent, with their uniforms prominently featuring the beret as a distinguishing mark. details.description: Description Products Description Size Large Material: T/C twill/plain Fabric Type: Polyester/Cotton /CVC Color: Multicam Hat Origin： Imported Products feature The Origin of the military Wide-Brimmed Hat The origin of the soldier's wide-brimmed hat can be traced back to the early 19th century in the armies of Western powers. Known as the "wide-brimmed hat," this military cap is characterized by a round shape, a flat top, and a large brim. The brim, although substantial, differs from what is commonly referred to as a "brim" in casual terms; here, it actually refers to the edge of the hat. This design not only serves practical purposes, such as providing shade and protecting the head from harsh weather, but also carries symbolic significance, representing the honor and status of military personnel. In Asia In Asia, Japan was the first country to adopt the wide-brimmed hat. During the Meiji Restoration, Japan reformed its military uniforms and designed a cylindrical military hat as its first headgear, gradually transitioning to the wide-brimmed hat. In 1905, with the establishment of the "Type 38" military uniform, the top and brim of the military cap were further enlarged, solidifying the design of the wide-brimmed hat. This style was later adopted by the Japanese military and other countries influenced by it. In china The history of the wide-brimmed hat in the Chinese military dates back to the late Qing Dynasty during the Beiyang Army period. At that time, the Beiyang Army sought to reform its military system by borrowing elements from the military uniform designs of Eastern and Western powers, including the wide-brimmed hat. In the lead-up to the 1911 Xinhai Revolution, the uniforms of the new army were adjusted, and the soldiers' everyday uniforms were updated to include the wide-brimmed hat, which resembled Japan's "Type 38" military cap. Subsequently, the wide-brimmed hat gradually became one of the standard military hats in the Chinese army, undergoing various transformations and developments. Soldier wide-brimmed In summary, the soldier's wide-brimmed hat can be traced back to the armies of Western powers in the early 19th century, with Japan being one of the first Asian countries to adopt it. The wide-brimmed hat in the Chinese military evolved under the influence of Japan and other nations, gradually developing into a distinctive military headgear of its own. details.description: Description Products Description Size Large Material: T/C twill/plain Fabric Type: Polyester/Cotton /CVC Color: Multicam Hat Origin： Imported Products feature The production process of camouflage military hats mainly involves the following steps Final Design First, designers create the camouflage pattern and go through multiple revisions and optimizations until achieving a satisfactory result. This step is the foundation of the entire production process, determining the final product's appearance and quality. Pattern Making Once the design is finalized, it needs to be converted into a production-ready format. This step involves translating the design into specific pattern data, preparing for subsequent production. Printing and Dyeing At the dyeing factory, technicians use specialized equipment to sensitize and transfer the designed camouflage pattern onto the printing machine's roller or screen. Based on the different colors in the camouflage pattern, various color plates are created, and through multiple color adjustments and dyeing processes, the entire camouflage pattern is produced. This step is critical to the production process, directly affecting the clarity of the camouflage pattern and the accuracy of its colors. Cutting and Sewing After printing and dyeing, the garment factory cuts the fabric according to the paper patterns, shaping each part of the hat. The parts are then sewn together to form a complete camouflage military hat. This step requires skilled workers to ensure that the quality and appearance of the hat meet design specifications. Quality Inspection Finally, the completed camouflage military hats undergo a quality inspection to ensure that each hat meets quality standards. This step is crucial for guaranteeing product quality; through strict quality checks, unqualified products can be prevented from entering the market. Summarize The entire production process requires close cooperation and meticulous operations across multiple stages to ensure that the final product's quality and appearance meet expected standards. Additionally, for fabrics with special performance requirements (such as waterproofing or flame resistance), the printing and dyeing process may be adjusted to meet different usage needs. Produit detail Frequently Asked Questions What are the precautions for washing camouflage military caps? The washing instructions for camouflage military hats mainly include using a soft brush and neutral detergent, controlling the water temperature to not exceed 40°C, avoiding machine washing, and drying in a cool, ventilated area. **Use a Soft Brush and Neutral Detergent**: When washing, gently scrub the hat with a soft brush to avoid damaging the camouflage pattern. A neutral detergent is recommended, as strong alkaline or acidic cleaners can harm the camouflage coating and affect the hat's appearance and lifespan. **Control Water Temperature to Not Exceed 40°C**: High water temperatures can cause the camouflage coating to peel or deform, so it's important to keep the water temperature below 40°C to protect the coating. **Avoid Machine Washing**: Machine washing is strictly prohibited, as the intense agitation and friction can damage the camouflage pattern and distort the hat. Hand washing is advised for gentle care. **Dry in a Cool, Ventilated Area**: When drying, choose a dry, ventilated space away from direct sunlight to prevent fading. Avoid folding or pressing the hat to maintain its shape. Following these precautions effectively protects the appearance and longevity of the camouflage military hat while ensuring the integrity of the pattern and functionality. Here are some suggestions for tactical fanny pack care and maintenance: 1. Clean surfaces regularly Regular cleaning of the surface of the tactical waist bag is the basis of maintenance. Use mild detergent and a soft cloth to wipe the surface to remove dust and dirt. Avoid using cleaners that contain strong chemicals that can damage the material. 2. Avoid pressure from heavy objects When carrying or storing, avoid heavy objects pressing on the tactical waist bag to avoid deformation or damage. Reasonably distribute the load to ensure load balancing of the beltpack. 3. Waterproofing is essential For tactical waist bags with waterproof functions, regular waterproofing treatments can maintain their good waterproof performance. Follow the instructions in the product manual to use a special waterproofing agent and make sure the treatment is even. 4. Check zippers and buckles Zippers and buckles are important parts of a tactical waist bag and need to be checked regularly to see if they are smooth and tight. If it is damaged or loose, it should be repaired or replaced in time to ensure its normal use. 5. Do not expose yourself to the sun for a long time Prolonged exposure to the sun will cause the material of the tactical waist bag to age, discolor, and even affect its functionality. Therefore, avoid long-term exposure to sunlight when storing or using, and try to choose a cool and ventilated place. 6. Store and preserve properly Tactical fanny packs should be properly stored and stored when not in use. Avoid stacking it randomly in a humid or dirty environment. It is best to place it in a dry, ventilated, dark place, and cover it with a dust cover. 7. Avoid contact with sharp objects When carrying or using a tactical waist bag, avoid contact with sharp objects to prevent scratches or breakage. If possible, a protective sleeve or guard can be installed on the outside of the tactical belt bag to increase its wear resistance. 8. Replace wearing parts regularly During the use of the tactical waist bag, some wearing parts such as zippers, buckles, shoulder straps, etc. may become worn or damaged. In order to ensure its performance and safety, these wearing parts should be inspected and replaced regularly. By following the care and maintenance recommendations above, you can extend the life of your tactical fanny pack and maintain its good performance and appearance. At the same time, it can also ensure safer and more reliable use. name: Cycling Waist Pouch Bag Mil-Spec Tactical Fanny Pack
description: Product name:: Tactical Pouch. Type:: Tactical. Feature:: Waterproof,Rip-stop,Wearproof.

details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Product name: Tactical Pouch Type: Tactical Feature: Waterproof,Rip-stop,Wearproof Color: Black,Mud,Army Green,CP,Black CP OEM&ODM: Accaptable Feature The special use of tactical belt bags in tactical operations As an important part of tactical equipment, tactical belt bags play an indispensable role in tactical operations. In addition to the common carrying and storage functions, tactical fanny packs also have the following special uses: 1. Quickly access equipment and supplies: In tactical operations, time and speed often determine success or failure. Tactical waist bags are designed with special quick-access pockets, allowing soldiers to take out required equipment and supplies, such as pistols, grenades, first aid kits, etc., in a very short time. The waist position allows for quick maneuvering while soldiers are marching, crouching or crawling. 2. Maintain survival and combat effectiveness: Tactical pockets can carry food, water, medicine and other survival necessities to ensure that soldiers can maintain basic survival and combat effectiveness during long-term operations or harsh environments. Special compartment designs prevent these supplies from being squeezed or damaged during operations. 3. Carry tactical tools and accessories: Tactical belt bags are usually equipped with a variety of tactical tools, such as compasses, whistles, ropes, etc. These tools may play a key role in tactical operations. Soldiers can take out these tools from their belt packs at any time as needed to deal with various complex and unexpected situations. 4. Hiding and disguise: Tactical fanny packs often come in stealthy colors and designs, allowing soldiers to better disguise themselves while performing missions and reduce the risk of detection. Components such as the zipper and buckle on the belt pack have also been carefully designed to ensure that operation is as silent as possible during tactical operations. 5. Adaptability and flexibility: Tactical fanny packs often have adjustable belt lengths to accommodate soldiers with different waist sizes. In addition, the multiple pockets and compartments on the waist pack can be flexibly configured according to mission requirements to meet the needs of soldiers carrying different types and quantities of equipment and supplies. 6. Support and protection: The structural design of tactical waist packs takes into account the comfort and safety of soldiers. The belts are usually made of soft and wear-resistant materials to reduce pressure and friction on the waist. The compartments and padding inside the waist bag can effectively protect the equipment and supplies you carry from external impacts and collisions. To sum up, tactical belt bags have special uses in tactical operations such as quick access, maintaining survival and combat effectiveness, carrying tactical tools, concealment and camouflage, adaptability and flexibility, and support and protection. These features make the tactical belt bag an important partner and reliable guarantee for soldiers in tactical operations. name: Outdoor Gear Tactical Leg Waist Bag Pack Fanny Bag
description: Product name:: Tactical Pouch. Type:: Tactical. Feature:: Waterproof,Rip-stop,Wearproof.

details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Product name: Tactical Pouch Type: Tactical Feature: Waterproof,Rip-stop,Wearproof Color: Black,Mud,Army Green,CP,Black CP OEM&ODM: Accaptable Feature Tactical fanny pack care and maintenance methods Tactical fanny packs are important equipment in outdoor activities or tactical operations, and correct care and maintenance are crucial to their service life and performance. Here are some suggestions for tactical fanny pack care and maintenance: 1. Clean surfaces regularly Regular cleaning of the surface of the tactical waist bag is the basis of maintenance. Use mild detergent and a soft cloth to wipe the surface to remove dust and dirt. Avoid using cleaners that contain strong chemicals that can damage the material. 2. Avoid pressure from heavy objects When carrying or storing, avoid heavy objects pressing on the tactical waist bag to avoid deformation or damage. Reasonably distribute the load to ensure load balancing of the beltpack. 3. Waterproofing is essential For tactical waist bags with waterproof functions, regular waterproofing treatments can maintain their good waterproof performance. Follow the instructions in the product manual to use a special waterproofing agent and make sure the treatment is even. 4. Check zippers and buckles Zippers and buckles are important parts of a tactical waist bag and need to be checked regularly to see if they are smooth and tight. If it is damaged or loose, it should be repaired or replaced in time to ensure its normal use. 5. Do not expose yourself to the sun for a long time Prolonged exposure to the sun will cause the material of the tactical waist bag to age, discolor, and even affect its functionality. Therefore, avoid long-term exposure to sunlight when storing or using, and try to choose a cool and ventilated place. 6. Store and preserve properly Tactical fanny packs should be properly stored and stored when not in use. Avoid stacking it randomly in a humid or dirty environment. It is best to place it in a dry, ventilated, dark place, and cover it with a dust cover. 7. Avoid contact with sharp objects When carrying or using a tactical waist bag, avoid contact with sharp objects to prevent scratches or breakage. If possible, a protective sleeve or guard can be installed on the outside of the tactical belt bag to increase its wear resistance. 8. Replace wearing parts regularly During the use of the tactical waist bag, some wearing parts such as zippers, buckles, shoulder straps, etc. may become worn or damaged. In order to ensure its performance and safety, these wearing parts should be inspected and replaced regularly. By following the care and maintenance recommendations above, you can extend the life of your tactical fanny pack and maintain its good performance and appearance. At the same time, it can also ensure safer and more reliable use. It mainly consists of two parts: a jacket and a bulletproof layer. Clothing covers are usually made of chemical fiber fabrics, while the bulletproof layer is made of a variety of materials, such as metal (special steel, aluminum alloy, titanium alloy), ceramic sheets (boron carbide, silicon carbide, alumina), fiberglass, nylon (PA), Kevlar (KEVLAR), ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene fiber (DOYENTRONTEX Fiber), liquid protective materials, polyimide fiber (PI), etc. These materials can exist in the form of single or composite protective structures. The bulletproof layer of the bulletproof vest can absorb the kinetic energy of warheads or shrapnel, has a significant protective effect on low-speed warheads or shrapnel, and can reduce the damage to the human chest and abdomen while controlling a certain depression. Different types of bulletproof vests, such as infantry bulletproof vests, flight personnel bulletproof vests and artillery bulletproof vests, as well as bulletproof vests, full protection bulletproof vests and women's bulletproof vests classified by appearance, all have their own characteristics and applicable scenarios. It should be noted that bulletproof vests are not a panacea, and most protective clothing have little or no protection against large-caliber rifles or rifles. However, they provide better protection against handgun ammunition fired from handguns, regardless of type, model, material or caliber of pistol ammunition. Some types of bulletproof vests are also filled with protective materials such as metal, ceramic or polyethylene plates in key areas to increase protection. These vests became standard in military use because they protect against bullets from all handguns and some rifles. Additionally, some vests are designed to protect against knife attacks. In short, bulletproof vests are an important piece of personal protective equipment that can reduce the damage caused by warheads or shrapnel to the human body to a certain extent. However, it is not a panacea. It is necessary to choose appropriate protective equipment according to the actual situation and follow the correct usage and precautions when using it. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Style of Ballistic Helmet Pasgt, Mich2000, Fast, Ach, Af Style Helmet Bullet Info of Bulletproof Helmet 8.1g, 15.6g Bullet Color of Bulletproof Helmet Tactical / Combat / Training / War Games / Outdoor / Cosplay Weight 1.3-1.7kg/Pic with Different Accessories V50 Value of Ballistic Helmet with Aramid, It Can Reach 650-680m/S Production Capacity 500000PCS/Year Feature A ballistic helmet is a type of protective equipment primarily used to protect the head from threats such as bullets, shrapnel, and fragments. It uses a range of designs and materials to provide effective protection. The following will introduce the principles of bulletproof helmets from three aspects: material selection, structural design and working principle. Material selection is a very important part of bulletproof helmet design. Ballistic helmets often use composite materials to improve impact resistance and protection. These composite materials are usually composed of multiple layers of materials with different properties, including metals, ceramics, and polymer materials. The metal layer can effectively disperse and absorb impact energy, the ceramic layer has high hardness and impact resistance, and the polymer material can provide additional buffering and energy-absorbing capabilities. The combination of these materials can reduce the impact force on the head when the head is impacted. The structural design of a bulletproof helmet is also a key factor in ensuring its protective capabilities. Usually, a bulletproof helmet consists of three parts: shell, pads and suspension system. The shell is the outer protective layer of the helmet and is made of hard material that can withstand external impact and pressure. Pads are soft materials inside the helmet that are used to cushion and absorb impact energy. The suspension system is used to fix the position of the helmet on the head, so that the helmet can fit the head closely and provide the best protective effect. This structural design can reduce the transmission of impact energy to the head, thereby protecting the head from injury. The working principle of ballistic helmets is based on a mechanism of energy dispersion and absorption. When the helmet suffers an impact, the impact energy is effectively dispersed and absorbed due to the shell and pads. The outer shell can disperse the impact force to the entire helmet surface and reduce the impact force through the process of elastic deformation and elastic recovery. At the same time, the pads can absorb impact energy through compression and deformation. This energy dispersion and absorption mechanism can reduce the impact force on the head, thereby effectively protecting the head. Bulletproof helmets provide effective head protection through optimization in many aspects such as material selection, structural design and working principles. It can protect people's heads in hazardous environments such as impacts and explosions, reducing the risk of head injuries. However, it is important to note that ballistic helmets do not completely eliminate the risk, but rather minimize the possibility of head injury. Therefore, in dangerous environments, people should also take other protective measures, such as wearing body armor and avoiding exposure to dangerous areas, to maximize their own safety. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Style of Ballistic Helmet Pasgt, Mich2000, Fast, Ach, Af Style Helmet Bullet Info of Bulletproof Helmet 8.1g, 15.6g Bullet Color of Bulletproof Helmet Tactical / Combat / Training / War Games / Outdoor / Cosplay Weight 1.3-1.7kg/Pic with Different Accessories V50 Value of Ballistic Helmet with Aramid, It Can Reach 650-680m/S Production Capacity 500000PCS/Year Feature First of all, the key to making a lightweight high-protection PE bulletproof helmet lies in the selection of materials. Traditional bulletproof helmets are mostly made of steel plates or ceramic materials, which are heavy and airtight. PE material is lightweight, high-strength, and impact-resistant, making it an ideal choice for making lightweight, high-protection bulletproof helmets. Secondly, the molding method for making lightweight and high-protection PE bulletproof helmets is hot press molding. First, the PE material is cut into blocks of appropriate size and then placed in a heat press for heating. While heating, the PE material is pressed through a mold to shape it into the shape of the helmet. The advantage of hot press molding is that it can make the PE material soft and easy to form at high temperatures, and it can maintain the overall performance of the helmet. During the molding process, attention needs to be paid to controlling the temperature and time of hot pressing. Too high a temperature will cause the PE material to melt, while too low a temperature will prevent it from forming. Therefore, the appropriate temperature needs to be determined based on the characteristics of the PE material and molding requirements. At the same time, the hot pressing time also needs to be controlled well. If it is too long, it will cause the PE material to deform, and if it is too short, it will not be fully formed. After the molding is completed, the lightweight and high-protection PE bulletproof helmet still needs to be processed. The first step is to trim the helmet and cut off excess material to make it more conformable to the shape of the head. Then the helmet is surface treated, usually by spraying or film, to increase the helmet's aesthetics and wear resistance. The last step is to assemble the helmet, including installing the lining, adjusting the straps, etc. to ensure the comfort and stability of the helmet. By selecting appropriate materials and using thermoforming methods, it is possible to produce lightweight, high-protective ballistic helmets. However, strict temperature and time control are required during the production process, as well as subsequent processing to ensure the quality and performance of the helmet. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Style of Ballistic Helmet Pasgt, Mich2000, Fast, Ach, Af Style Helmet Bullet Info of Bulletproof Helmet 8.1g, 15.6g Bullet Color of Bulletproof Helmet Tactical / Combat / Training / War Games / Outdoor / Cosplay Weight 1.3-1.7kg/Pic with Different Accessories V50 Value of Ballistic Helmet with Aramid, It Can Reach 650-680m/S Production Capacity 500000PCS/Year Feature A ballistic helmet is a type of protective equipment primarily used to protect the head from threats such as bullets, shrapnel, and fragments. It uses a range of designs and materials to provide effective protection. The following will introduce the principles of bulletproof helmets from three aspects: material selection, structural design and working principle. Material selection is a very important part of bulletproof helmet design. Ballistic helmets often use composite materials to improve impact resistance and protection. These composite materials are usually composed of multiple layers of materials with different properties, including metals, ceramics, and polymer materials. The metal layer can effectively disperse and absorb impact energy, the ceramic layer has high hardness and impact resistance, and the polymer material can provide additional buffering and energy-absorbing capabilities. The combination of these materials can reduce the impact force on the head when the head is impacted. The structural design of a bulletproof helmet is also a key factor in ensuring its protective capabilities. Usually, a bulletproof helmet consists of three parts: shell, pads and suspension system. The shell is the outer protective layer of the helmet and is made of hard material that can withstand external impact and pressure. Pads are soft materials inside the helmet that are used to cushion and absorb impact energy. The suspension system is used to fix the position of the helmet on the head, so that the helmet can fit the head closely and provide the best protective effect. This structural design can reduce the transmission of impact energy to the head, thereby protecting the head from injury. The working principle of ballistic helmets is based on a mechanism of energy dispersion and absorption. When the helmet suffers an impact, the impact energy is effectively dispersed and absorbed due to the shell and pads. The outer shell can disperse the impact force to the entire helmet surface and reduce the impact force through the process of elastic deformation and elastic recovery. At the same time, the pads can absorb impact energy through compression and deformation. This energy dispersion and absorption mechanism can reduce the impact force on the head, thereby effectively protecting the head. Bulletproof helmets provide effective head protection through optimization in many aspects such as material selection, structural design and working principles. It can protect people's heads in hazardous environments such as impacts and explosions, reducing the risk of head injuries. However, it is important to note that ballistic helmets do not completely eliminate the risk, but rather minimize the possibility of head injury. Therefore, in dangerous environments, people should also take other protective measures, such as wearing body armor and avoiding exposure to dangerous areas, to maximize their own safety. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Style of Ballistic Helmet Pasgt, Mich2000, Fast, Ach, Af Style Helmet Bullet Info of Bulletproof Helmet 8.1g, 15.6g Bullet Color of Bulletproof Helmet Tactical / Combat / Training / War Games / Outdoor / Cosplay Weight 1.3-1.7kg/Pic with Different Accessories V50 Value of Ballistic Helmet with Aramid, It Can Reach 650-680m/S Production Capacity 500000PCS/Year Feature First of all, the key to making a lightweight high-protection PE bulletproof helmet lies in the selection of materials. Traditional bulletproof helmets are mostly made of steel plates or ceramic materials, which are heavy and airtight. PE material is lightweight, high-strength, and impact-resistant, making it an ideal choice for making lightweight, high-protection bulletproof helmets. Secondly, the molding method for making lightweight and high-protection PE bulletproof helmets is hot press molding. First, the PE material is cut into blocks of appropriate size and then placed in a heat press for heating. While heating, the PE material is pressed through a mold to shape it into the shape of the helmet. The advantage of hot press molding is that it can make the PE material soft and easy to form at high temperatures, and it can maintain the overall performance of the helmet. During the molding process, attention needs to be paid to controlling the temperature and time of hot pressing. Too high a temperature will cause the PE material to melt, while too low a temperature will prevent it from forming. Therefore, the appropriate temperature needs to be determined based on the characteristics of the PE material and molding requirements. At the same time, the hot pressing time also needs to be controlled well. If it is too long, it will cause the PE material to deform, and if it is too short, it will not be fully formed. After the molding is completed, the lightweight and high-protection PE bulletproof helmet still needs to be processed. The first step is to trim the helmet and cut off excess material to make it more conformable to the shape of the head. Then the helmet is surface treated, usually by spraying or film, to increase the helmet's aesthetics and wear resistance. The last step is to assemble the helmet, including installing the lining, adjusting the straps, etc. to ensure the comfort and stability of the helmet. By selecting appropriate materials and using thermoforming methods, it is possible to produce lightweight, high-protective ballistic helmets. However, strict temperature and time control are required during the production process, as well as subsequent processing to ensure the quality and performance of the helmet. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Style of Ballistic Helmet Pasgt, Mich2000, Fast, Ach, Af Style Helmet Bullet Info of Bulletproof Helmet 8.1g, 15.6g Bullet Color of Bulletproof Helmet Tactical / Combat / Training / War Games / Outdoor / Cosplay Weight 1.3-1.7kg/Pic with Different Accessories V50 Value of Ballistic Helmet with Aramid, It Can Reach 650-680m/S Production Capacity 500000PCS/Year Feature Ballistic helmet standards refer to a series of specifications and test methods used to test and evaluate the protective performance of ballistic helmets to ensure that the helmet can effectively protect personnel from dangers such as gunfire. Currently widely used ballistic helmet standards include: NIJ 0106.01 standard: Developed by the National Institute of Justice (NIJ), it is divided into three levels. Helmets are tested differently according to their protection level. EN 397 standard: Developed by the European Organization for Standardization (CEN), it is mainly used for industrial safety helmets and can also be used for testing bulletproof helmets. PASGT standard: This is the US military's testing standard for MICH and ACH helmets to ensure that they can provide sufficient protection in combat. STANAG 2920 Standard: Developed by NATO, it can be used to test face and head protection, including ballistic mask and helmet combinations. Chinese Bulletproof Helmet Standard: A standard issued by my country's National Security Industry Standardization Technical Committee to ensure the protective performance of bulletproof helmets for domestic military and police officers. In addition to the above commonly used bulletproof helmet standards, some regions and militaries will develop their own standards and testing methods to meet their specific protection needs. In addition to testing standards, the design and materials of ballistic helmets are also critical. They must be able to effectively absorb and disperse ballistic energy while minimizing the impact of the helmet on the wearer, such as weight, visibility and comfort. When purchasing and wearing a ballistic helmet, not only do you need to consider testing standards and design, but you also need to ensure that the helmet fits the size and shape of the wearer's head to ensure optimal protection. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Style of Ballistic Helmet Pasgt, Mich2000, Fast, Ach, Af Style Helmet Bullet Info of Bulletproof Helmet 8.1g, 15.6g Bullet Color of Bulletproof Helmet Tactical / Combat / Training / War Games / Outdoor / Cosplay Weight 1.3-1.7kg/Pic with Different Accessories V50 Value of Ballistic Helmet with Aramid, It Can Reach 650-680m/S Production Capacity 500000PCS/Year Feature Bulletproof helmets made of different materials each have their own advantages and disadvantages. Metal bulletproof helmets, such as steel helmets, have the advantage of strong protective capabilities and can withstand a variety of threats. However, they are often heavy, can cause stress on the neck and shoulders when worn for long periods of time, and the metal can become very hot or cold in extreme environments, affecting the wearer's comfort. Bulletproof helmets made of non-metallic materials, such as ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene fiber and aramid, have the advantages of being light in weight, comfortable to wear, and have good protective capabilities. Helmets made of these materials also usually have excellent impact resistance and penetration resistance, which can effectively protect the head from injury. However, non-metallic helmets may not be as durable as metal helmets and may be damaged in some extreme environments. Composite bulletproof helmets combine the advantages of metal and non-metal materials and have lighter weight, good protection capabilities and comfort. However, the manufacturing process of composite materials can be complex and costly. In general, which material of bulletproof helmet to choose depends on the specific usage scenarios and needs. For example, on the battlefield, a heavier, more protective metal helmet may be needed; while in situations where helmets need to be worn for extended periods of time, such as police or SWAT, non-metallic or composite helmets may be more suitable. No matter which helmet material you choose, you should ensure that it complies with relevant safety standards and regulations to ensure the safety of the wearer. details.description: Description Products Detail PASGT M88 TACTICAL HELMETS PASGT M88 Tactical Helmets is ABS plastic and nylon webbing, high-quality nylon webbing and metal nails; breathable and effectively protects the head from injury.PASGT stands for Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops, referring to the new Kevlar helmet and matching Kevlar vest. The PASGT vest is also developed by NADIC. specification Weight: 600 Grams Material:‎‎ Nylon+ABS Size: 27 * 25 * 18.5cm Head circumference: 54-62cm (21-24.4 inches) Special Feature Adjustable,Lightweight detail show Comfortable buckle strap Comfortable chin neck pad Ear protection Paddy buffer feature ABS helmet useful for paintball or airsoft games in black color Tactical Helmet measures 11"L x 10"W x 7.5"H and the inside diameter is 7" Adjustable Chin Strap, One Size Fits Most. Not meant to provide any protection or safety Lightweight and comfortable,breathable and effectively protects the head from injury. PASGT Helmet History The PASGT helmet, short for Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops, is produced by several manufacturers according to military standard MIL-H44099A. Its design primarily focuses on protection against shrapnel from grenades, mines, mortars, and bombs, rather than direct rifle fire. Featuring a two-layer suspension system, it maintains a 1.3 cm gap from the head for ventilation while effectively reducing impact. With a protection area of 1,129 square centimeters, it can withstand shrapnel impacts at a V50 ballistic value of 663 m/s and endure temperatures up to 190°C, offering a 121% improvement in protection over the older M1 helmet, which has a V50 of around 300 m/s. The helmet secures with a two-point system, and its adjustable straps accommodate various head sizes. Additionally, it includes an elastic "cat-eye strap" for securing camouflage, featuring reflective patches for night operations. After its introduction, U.S. soldiers nicknamed it "Fritz" due to its comfort and protection, considering it vital gear. A PASGT helmet on display at the 82nd Airborne Division Museum successfully stopped an AK-47 round during the invasion of Grenada. Gentex, a major manufacturer based in Carbondale, Pennsylvania, produced civilian safety helmets based on the PASGT, but high costs and unusual design limited sales. Since its launch in the 1980s, the PASGT helmet has undergone multiple enhancements to improve comfort, stability, and protection, including the use of Kevlar KM2 fiber for a tighter weave and a 10% weight reduction, increasing the V50 value to 686 m/s. The U.S. Marine Corps began using Spectra fiber from Honeywell in the late 1990s, which offers better ballistic performance while being over 30% lighter than Kevlar. However, its manufacturing challenges could lead to delamination in field conditions. The suspension system has also been improved for better sweat absorption and comfort, with detachable padding for airborne troops. A modified version, the Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), introduced in 2001, provides enhanced protection, practicality, and comfort. MICH has a shallower profile than PASGT, eliminates the brim, and integrates multiple Kevlar fibers. It features a new seven-pad suspension system and allows for the installation of communication modules beneath the ear protection, improving battlefield awareness. The revolutionary PASGT helmet has been widely adopted by other Western countries, and China's new QGF-02 bulletproof helmet is modeled after it, made from domestic aramid fibers and featuring a design that enhances comfort and stability. Since the 1970s, the trend has shifted towards non-metal composite helmets, greatly boosting soldiers' morale and confidence.
