details.description: Description Products Paramoter size 40*30CM Adjustable waist size 105-150CM color MC camouflage, military green, khaki, black, gray weight 1.8kg Material 1000D polyester Adjustable Removable and adjustable Accessories Vest main body*1, single equipment bag*2, triple equipment bag*1, miscellaneous bag*2, hydration bag*1 Customizable Support size and color customization feature Bulletproof vest is a kind of protective equipment used to protect the human body from harm caused by bullets or shrapnel. It mainly consists of two parts: a jacket and a bulletproof layer. Clothing covers are usually made of chemical fiber fabrics, while the bulletproof layer is made of a variety of materials, such as metal (special steel, aluminum alloy, titanium alloy), ceramic sheets (boron carbide, silicon carbide, alumina), fiberglass, nylon (PA), Kevlar (KEVLAR), ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene fiber (DOYENTRONTEX Fiber), liquid protective materials, polyimide fiber (PI), etc. These materials can exist in the form of single or composite protective structures. The bulletproof layer of the bulletproof vest can absorb the kinetic energy of warheads or shrapnel, has a significant protective effect on low-speed warheads or shrapnel, and can reduce the damage to the human chest and abdomen while controlling a certain depression. Different types of bulletproof vests, such as infantry bulletproof vests, flight personnel bulletproof vests and artillery bulletproof vests, as well as bulletproof vests, full protection bulletproof vests and women's bulletproof vests classified by appearance, all have their own characteristics and applicable scenarios. It should be noted that bulletproof vests are not a panacea, and most protective clothing have little or no protection against large-caliber rifles or rifles. However, they provide better protection against handgun ammunition fired from handguns, regardless of type, model, material or caliber of pistol ammunition. Some types of bulletproof vests are also filled with protective materials such as metal, ceramic or polyethylene plates in key areas to increase protection. These vests became standard in military use because they protect against bullets from all handguns and some rifles. Additionally, some vests are designed to protect against knife attacks. In short, bulletproof vests are an important piece of personal protective equipment that can reduce the damage caused by warheads or shrapnel to the human body to a certain extent. However, it is not a panacea. It is necessary to choose appropriate protective equipment according to the actual situation and follow the correct usage and precautions when using it. It does not have bulletproof function, so it is not a controlled item. As long as the tactical vest is purchased through normal channels, whether it is for personal protection or collection, it is legal. Q: What vest do Navy Seals use? The design concept of this system is to add a standardized equipment interface to the tactical vest, bag, belt and other equipment, and make a large number of convenient and fixed PAL webbing on the carrier, which can be matched with equipment that meets the tactical needs according to the different types of soldiers' tasks, which is more practical and in line with the different changes of modern war. So that military and law enforcement personnel can better carry and use tactical equipment. MOLLE is a modular bearing system designed to enhance the survivability and combat effectiveness of modern soldiers and marines. Molle replaces the current ALICE system and integrates individual and integrated components of the tactical system, including enhanced tactical bearing vests The prototype MOLLE system was developed by the U.S. Army Soldier Systems Center to replace the previous ALICE backpack. After an evaluation by the Military Physics and Mechanics Research Center, the MOLLE backpack was approved and experiments began. Soldiers of the 25th Infantry Division in Hawaii tested the MOLLE system for six months, and the system received positive reviews, even when carrying more than 109 pounds, the impact on combat operations was minimal. Overall, the MOLLE system is an efficient and flexible modular tactical equipment system that helps improve the efficiency and safety of military and law enforcement personnel in combat or on mission. Products feature The bullet-proof mechanism of body armor is fundamentally two: first, the fragments formed after the fragmentation of the bomb body are bounced open; The second is to dissipate the kinetic energy of the warhead through bulletproof material. The first body armor developed in the United States in the 1920s and 1930s relied on lap steel plates attached to strong clothing to provide protection. This body armor, and later similar hard body armor, was bulletproof either by bouncing off the bullet or shrapnel, or by fragmenting the bullet to dissipate its energy. With high-performance fiber as the main bulletproof material of the soft body armor, its bulletproof mechanism is mainly based on the latter, that is, the use of high-strength fiber as the raw material of the fabric "catch" bullet or shrapnel to achieve the purpose of bulletproof. Studies have shown that there are five ways in which soft bulletproof vests absorb energy: (1) Fabric deformation: including the deformation of the bullet incident direction and the tensile deformation of the area near the incident point; (2) Fabric damage: including fiber fibrillation, fiber breakage, yarn structure disintegration and fabric structure disintegration; (3) Thermal energy: energy is dissipated by friction in the form of thermal energy; (4) Sound energy: the energy consumed by the sound emitted by the bullet after hitting the bulletproof layer; (5) Deformation of the projectile body. In order to improve the bullet-proof ability and the development of soft and hard composite body armor, its bullet-proof mechanism can be summarized by "both soft and hard". When a bullet hits a body armor, the first thing that acts on it is a hard bulletproof material such as steel plate or reinforced ceramic material. In this instantaneous contact process, the bullet and hard bulletproof material are likely to be deformed or broken, consuming most of the energy of the bullet. The high-strength fiber fabric acts as the liner and the second line of defense of the body armor, absorbing and diffusing the energy of the remaining part of the bullet, and acting as a buffer, thus reducing the non-penetrating damage as much as possible. In these two bulletproof processes, the former one plays the main role of energy absorption, greatly reducing the penetration force of the projectile, which is the key to bulletproof. In order to ensure that bulletproof vests can provide effective protection in actual use, we need to conduct a comprehensive evaluation from multiple aspects. II. Evaluation Methods 1. Material Strength test : Assess the resistance of bulletproof vest materials to bullet impact. By testing the material's resistance to penetration at different strengths, it is possible to understand the performance and potential weaknesses of the material. 2. Firing distance effect : Test the protective effect of bulletproof vests at different firing distances. In general, as the shooting distance increases, the protective effect of bulletproof vests may decrease. Therefore, it is necessary to evaluate the protection capability of the vest at different distances. 3. Different types : Different bullet types and calibers may have different effects on the protective effectiveness of a bulletproof vest. Evaluating the protective effect of bulletproof vests against various types of ammunition can provide a more comprehensive understanding of their performance. 4. Multiple Shot Assessment : Bulletproof vests can be shot multiple times in actual use. Therefore, it is necessary to evaluate the performance changes of bulletproof vests after multiple shots to ensure their continued effective protection. 5. Comfort : Comfort is an important consideration for soldiers when wearing bulletproof vests for extended periods of time. Assessing the comfort of wearing a bulletproof vest can ensure that soldiers stay in top shape while on duty. 6. Activity effects : Soldiers need to be highly flexible and agile in carrying out their missions. Assessing the impact of a bulletproof vest on a soldier's mobility ensures that the vest does not place undue restrictions on the soldier's movement. 7. Environmental considerations : Under different environmental conditions, the protective effect of bulletproof vests may change. For example, in hot or humid environments, the performance of bulletproof vests may be affected. Therefore, it is necessary to evaluate the performance of bulletproof vests under different environmental conditions. 8. Safety standard compliance : Assessing whether bulletproof vests meet national and international safety standards is an important means to ensure the performance and safety of vests. Bulletproof vests that meet safety standards ensure maximum protection for soldiers in use. III. Conclusion By comprehensively evaluating the above aspects, we can fully understand the protective effect of bulletproof vests. These assessment results will provide an important reference for soldiers in the selection and use of bulletproof vests, so as to ensure that their lives are protected to the greatest extent possible. Military personnel For soldiers, a belt with a suspension system can be used to carry various military equipment. For example, during mission execution, they can use the suspension system to attach equipment such as ammunition pouches, water bottles, and walkie-talkies. The MOLLE system (Modular Lightweight Load-carrying Equipment) can conveniently adjust the position and layout of equipment to adapt to different combat tasks and personal habits. Moreover, during marches or combat, the belt's fixing system and inner layer foam can provide a certain degree of comfort and reduce the pressure on the waist caused by the weight of equipment. Law enforcement officers When police perform tasks such as patrol, counter-terrorism, and emergency response, they need to carry equipment such as handcuffs, batons, law enforcement recorders, and walkie-talkies. A belt with a suspension system can allow these equipments to be hung on the belt in an orderly manner for convenient and quick access. For example, in an emergency situation of chasing a suspect, pepper spray and other equipments can be quickly removed from the belt. At the same time, low-key and deterrent colors such as black or military green in color selection also meet the needs of law enforcement scenarios. Outdoor adventure enthusiasts Hikers can use the suspension system of the belt to mount outdoor essential tools such as compasses, small first aid kits, and multifunctional knives. In the wild environment, the convenient access to each piece of equipment may be related to safety. Moreover, the width of the belt and the inner foam can provide good waist support during long walks or climbs and reduce fatigue. For example, during mountain climbing, the suspension system can also mount supplies such as energy bars and small oxygen cylinders for emergencies. Emergency rescue personnel Like firefighters when performing fire extinguishing and rescue tasks, they need to carry various rescue tools and protective equipment. The suspension system of the belt can be used to mount equipment such as fire axes, call devices, and lighting fixtures. Materials such as polypropylene webbing have certain flame retardancy and abrasion resistance and can adapt to complex rescue environments. At disaster rescue sites such as earthquakes and floods, it is convenient for rescuers to act quickly and the mounting position of equipment can be flexibly adjusted according to the actual situation. Tactical equipment enthusiasts (role-playing, simulating military activities) This group of people participate in military simulation games (such as Airsoft, MilSim) or engage in military role-playing activities. Moreover, multiple color options enable them to match equipment according to different simulation scenarios (such as simulated jungle combat, urban counter-terrorism, etc.). The inner layer is made of EVA sponge sandwich, which is comfortable and breathable. What are the common uses of tactical waist seals? Military use Equipment Carrying: In military operations, the tactical waistband is an important tool for soldiers to carry various equipment. For example, soldiers can attach multiple magazines on the waistband to ensure a sufficient supply of ammunition during combat. In some small-scale conflict scenarios in modern warfare, such as when special forces carry out counter-terrorism tasks, the spare magazines carried on the waistband can ensure continuous firing of firearms at critical moments and provide firepower support for the success of the mission. Tool Storage: Used for storing tools such as daggers and multi-function pliers. These tools are very crucial in scenarios such as wilderness survival, battlefield first aid, or equipment maintenance. For example, in field operations, soldiers can use daggers to cut ropes and open up paths. Multi-function pliers can be used to repair weapons and equipment or build temporary shelters. Communication and Navigation Equipment Mounting: Can mount communication and navigation equipment such as walkie-talkies and small GPS navigators. In a complex battlefield environment, communication equipment can ensure information exchange between soldiers and with the command center, enabling the troops to cooperate better in combat. Navigation equipment helps soldiers determine their positions and directions of advance. Especially when performing tasks in unfamiliar areas, such as in jungle, mountainous, or desert environments, its role is even more obvious. Law enforcement purposes Law enforcement equipment carrying: For police officers and special police forces, tactical waist belts are essential equipment in daily patrols and law enforcement operations. They can carry law enforcement tools such as handcuffs, batons, and tear gas sprays on the waist belt. In handling emergencies such as stopping criminal acts and arresting suspects, they can quickly access these equipment from the waist belt to improve law enforcement efficiency and their own safety. For example, if a police officer on patrol in the city streets encounters criminal acts such as robbery, they can quickly take out batons and handcuffs from the waist belt to respond. Storage of documents and recording tools: Law enforcement personnel can also put work documents, notebooks, etc. in the small pockets of the waist belt. During the law enforcement process, it is convenient to show their documents at any time to indicate their identity and can record case-related information such as the characteristics of suspects and the scene situation in a timely manner. Outdoor adventure uses Emergency supplies mounting: Outdoor adventure enthusiasts can use tactical waist belts to mount emergency supplies such as first aid kits, survival whistles, compasses, etc. In the wild environment, these emergency supplies may play a crucial role in cases of accidental injuries, getting lost, and other situations. For example, during mountain climbing, if someone is injured, the first aid kit on the waist belt can provide basic medical treatment; when lost, the compass can help explorers find the right direction. Personal items carrying: Tactical waist belts can also carry some personal items such as small water bottles, energy bars, etc. During long outdoor hikes or exploration activities, timely replenishment of water and energy is very important. These items are conveniently accessible when mounted on the waist belt. Best Selling Digital Camouflage view more Army Green view more Jungle Camouflage view more Kahki view more How to clean and maintain a tactical belt? --Cleaning method General stain cleaning For dust, dirt and other stains on the tactical belt, first, a clean soft brush can be used to gently brush off the dust and debris on the surface. For example, after coming back from outdoor exploration, there may be some dust and small particles on the belt. Using a soft brush can easily remove these impurities. If it is a light stain, such as sweat stains, a small amount of oil stains, etc., a mild detergent can be used for cleaning. Drop a small amount of neutral detergent (such as hand sanitizer without strong decontamination ingredients or professional fabric detergent) into warm water, then dip a clean soft cloth in the solution and gently wipe the stained area of the belt. Note that do not let the belt soak in water for a long time to avoid damaging the internal structure and material. Treatment of stubborn stains When there are stubborn stains on the tactical belt, such as dried paint, a large amount of oil stain or bloodstain, special detergents can be used. For example, for oil stains, detergents containing organic solvents can be selected, but first test on an inconspicuous small corner of the belt to ensure that it will not cause damage to the color and material of the belt. If it is stained with paint, paint thinner can be used, but also operate with caution. After using these strong detergents, wipe off the detergent with a clean wet cloth as soon as possible, then rinse with clean water, and finally let the belt air dry naturally. How to clean and maintain a tactical belt? --Maintenance points Avoid excessive use and damage In daily use, try to avoid making the tactical belt bear a weight exceeding its design load. For example, do not hang too many and overly heavy equipment on the belt to prevent the belt from deforming or the buckles from being damaged. If you need to hang heavier items, such as large radio equipment, ensure that the carrying capacity of the belt is sufficient and the weight is evenly distributed. Avoid contact between the belt and sharp objects to prevent scratches. During outdoor activities, pay attention to preventing the belt from being cut by sharp objects such as branches and rocks. When passing through thorny bushes or complex terrain, you can check the route in advance or use other protective measures (such as wrapping the belt part with clothing) to protect the belt. Regular inspection and maintenance Regularly check whether the buckle of the belt is working properly. Check whether the opening and closing of the metal buckle is smooth and whether the spring device is effective. For example, the buckle can be checked once a week to ensure that the belt can be unfastened and fastened smoothly in an emergency. Check whether the stitching part of the belt is loose or has broken threads. If there is a problem with the stitching, repair it in time. You can use thread of the same material as the belt for stitching. At the same time, also check whether the mounting points of the belt (such as hanging rings, fixed points of bags, etc.) are firm. If there is looseness, strengthen it in time. Notes on storage environment Tactical belts should be stored in a dry and well-ventilated environment. Avoid placing the belt in damp places such as basements or near bathrooms to prevent mildew and rusting of metal parts. The belt can be placed in a special equipment storage bag or a dry drawer. Before storage, make sure the belt is clean and dry. If the belt is wet, it must be dried before storage. And avoid prolonged exposure of the belt to direct sunlight, as ultraviolet rays may cause fading of the belt's color and aging of the material. details.description: Description product parameters Products name Tactical belt Products Color Black,Military green,Wolf brown,Royal blue,Dark gray,Military green camouflage,Classic camouflage,Red Locked edge (non-elastic style) Buckle material Zinc alloy Belt material Polyester elastic Whole weight 0.2kg Buckle size 7.2cm long and 5.0cm wide Belt size 125cm long and 3.8cm wide Note The length of this belt can be adjusted, but it cannot be shortened Products Brand Corhunter Easy and quick to unlock The belt body does not have the fixing holes of ordinary belts. The buckle pin can be inserted at any position. The tightness can be adjusted comfortably according to the waist circumference, and the design is user-friendly. What are the specific impacts of different materials of tactical belts on their performance? Tactical belts have extensive applications in military, outdoor and other fields. Different materials will have a significant impact on their performance. The following will provide a detailed introduction to different materials of tactical belts and their specific impacts on performance. Nylon High strength and wear resistance：Tactical belts made of nylon material usually have high strength and wear resistance. Oriented nylon 6 sheeting for core material promises extra long life for conveyor belting. Tests by Goodall Rubber Co., Trenton, N.J., indicate that nylon-cored belting may outlast conventional belting by as much as 100% in heavy duty applications. This shows that oriented nylon 6 sheeting as the core material can bring an extremely long service life to conveyor belts. Similarly, in tactical belts, nylon material can also provide good wear resistance and a relatively long service life, making it suitable for use in harsh environments. Lightweight and flexible: Nylon belts are relatively light and easy to carry and use. At the same time, it has a certain degree of flexibility and can adapt to different body movements and postures without causing excessive restraint to the user. This makes the user more flexible and at ease when performing tactical actions or outdoor activities. Corrosion resistance: Nylon has good corrosion resistance and can resist the erosion of sweat, rain, etc. In a humid environment, nylon belts are not easy to rust or be damaged and maintain good performance. polyester Stable property：Successful application of oriented-polyester film belts has been demonstrated in the Atlas-Score, Vanguard II, and Tiros I satellite tape recorders. Better performance of recorders in future NASA meteorological satellites may be expected if polyester film is used. Fatigue resistance, high stress tolerance, uniformity, and ability to be driven by extremely small pulleys are some of the many properties which make these belts superior for use in a number of mechanical instrumentation and power transmission applications.This shows that polyester material has good fatigue resistance, high stress tolerance and uniformity, and stable performance. In tactical belts, polyester material can also provide reliable performance and is not easily deformed or damaged. Lightweight and portable: Belts made of polyester material are usually relatively thin and lightweight, making them easy to carry and store. They do not take up too much space and are suitable for occasions where one needs to travel light. Wear-resistant: Polyester material has a certain degree of wear resistance and can withstand friction and wear in daily use. Although it may not be as wear-resistant as nylon material, it can generally meet the usage requirements of tactical belts. Copper Adapt to rifling: In the military field, for projectiles fired by breech-loading guns, the belts on the outer diameter of the projectiles usually use copper material. Literature 7 points out that "For projectiles fired by breech-loading guns, there are usually one or two 'belts' tied on the outer diameter of the projectiles. The professional term is belt. It uses a material softer than the rifling of the gun barrel. Generally, copper is inlaid on the projectile." Although the "belt" here is not a tactical belt, its characteristics can be borrowed. Copper material is relatively soft and can better adapt to the shape of rifling and play a role in sealing and guiding during the firing process. In tactical belts, belts made of copper material may have better flexibility and adaptability, able to fit the body curve and provide a comfortable wearing experience. Conductivity: Copper has good conductivity and may have certain uses in some special cases. For example, in occasions where electronic equipment needs to be connected or grounded, copper belts can play a certain role. Cloth material Youthful and casual style: Literature 9 mentions that "cloth belts are generally made of silk fabric. The colors and patterns are also relatively diverse. The style is youthful and casual, and easy to match." Cloth tactical belts usually have a youthful and casual appearance and are suitable for use in some informal occasions or daily wear. It can be matched with various clothing to show individuality and fashion sense. Comfort: Cloth belts are soft and comfortable, with less irritation to the skin. When worn for a long time, cloth belts can reduce the pressure on the waist and improve the comfort of wearing. Good breathability: Cloth material has good breathability and can allow air to circulate, avoiding sweating and sultriness on the waist. This is very important for people who use tactical belts in hot environments and can reduce discomfort. Artificial leather Leather-like appearance: The material of artificial leather belts is a leather-like material. It is described in literature 9. Artificial leather tactical belts have a leather-like appearance and look relatively high-end and fashionable. It can meet some people's requirements for appearance, and at the same time, the price is relatively cheaper than leather materials. Good waterproof performance: Artificial leather has certain waterproof performance and can prevent moisture penetration to a certain extent. This makes artificial leather belts able to maintain good performance and not be easily damaged by water when used in humid environments. Easy to clean: Artificial leather belts are relatively easy to clean and can be wiped with a damp cloth or cleaned with detergent. This is very convenient for tactical belts used in harsh environments and can keep the belt clean and hygienic. In conclusion, tactical belts of different materials have their own characteristics and advantages, and the impact on their performance is also different. When choosing a tactical belt, it is necessary to comprehensively consider the characteristics of the material according to specific usage needs and environments to choose the most suitable tactical belt for oneself. tactical Belt detail 01 Double card slot quick buckle system Quick buckle system, ergonomic design, easy to put on and take off. details.description: Description Produit Paramoter Product name tactical gloves Weight 102g Fabric Super fiber leather Palm: super fiber silicone style Outdoor, Tactical, Cycling, Troop Training color Desert yellow, olive green, night black. (Color can be customized) Feature Tactical gloves are important equipment in military operations, and proper care and maintenance can extend their service life and maintain their performance. Here are some guidelines on how to care for and maintain your tactical gloves: First, wash your tactical gloves regularly. After a fight or training, gloves can become stained with dirt and sweat, which can reduce their performance and cause odor. Gently wipe the surface of the glove with warm water and soap, then rinse with clean water and dry. Second, lubricate your tactical gloves regularly. Some gloves may be made from leather or synthetic materials, and regular use of an appropriate leather or synthetic lubricant will keep your gloves soft and prevent them from drying out and fading. Also, check your tactical gloves regularly to make sure they are in good condition. Check the glove's seams, patches, and other parts for signs of damage or wear, and promptly repair or replace damaged parts to ensure the integrity and performance of the glove. Finally, store your tactical gloves properly. Place gloves in a ventilated and dry place, away from direct sunlight and high temperature environments. Avoid storing gloves in wet or humid conditions for extended periods of time to prevent the growth of mold and bacteria. With proper care and maintenance, you can extend the life of your tactical gloves and maintain their performance, ensuring you always have reliable hand protection in combat. " application Shooting, Outdoor Sports, Cycling, Tactical gender Unisex Product Features Anti-wind and sand, double-sided anti-fog, anti-ultraviolet, shading Feature The night vision capabilities of tactical goggles are typically achieved through integrated night vision goggles or night vision technology. Night vision is an optoelectronic device that can observe targets under low-light conditions. It converts weak light signals into electrical signals and amplifies them, thereby enabling observation at night or in low-light environments. Night vision devices integrated into tactical goggles may use different types of night vision technology, the most common of which are infrared night vision technology and low-light night vision technology. Infrared night vision technology observes targets by receiving infrared radiation emitted by the target itself, while low-light night vision technology observes targets by enhancing the weak target image illuminated by night skylight. In tactical goggles, the night vision device is usually integrated into the frame of the goggle and used in conjunction with the eyepiece. When soldiers need to observe targets in low-light environments, they can turn on the night vision device and observe the target through the eyepiece. Night vision devices convert weak light signals into electrical signals and amplify them, presenting the image in the eyepiece for soldiers to observe. It should be noted that the night vision capability of night vision devices will be affected by factors such as ambient light conditions, target characteristics, and instrument quality. Therefore, when using the night vision function of tactical goggles, it needs to be evaluated and adjusted according to the actual situation to ensure the optimization of the observation effect. In addition, due to the high manufacturing and maintenance costs of night vision devices, economics and feasibility also need to be considered when purchasing and using them. Here are some guidelines on how to care for and maintain your tactical gloves: First, wash your tactical gloves regularly. After a fight or training, gloves can become stained with dirt and sweat, which can reduce their performance and cause odor. Gently wipe the surface of the glove with warm water and soap, then rinse with clean water and dry. Second, lubricate your tactical gloves regularly. Some gloves may be made from leather or synthetic materials, and regular use of an appropriate leather or synthetic lubricant will keep your gloves soft and prevent them from drying out and fading. Also, check your tactical gloves regularly to make sure they are in good condition. Check the glove's seams, patches, and other parts for signs of damage or wear, and promptly repair or replace damaged parts to ensure the integrity and performance of the glove. Finally, store your tactical gloves properly. Place gloves in a ventilated and dry place, away from direct sunlight and high temperature environments. Avoid storing gloves in wet or humid conditions for extended periods of time to prevent the growth of mold and bacteria. With proper care and maintenance, you can extend the life of your tactical gloves and maintain their performance, ensuring you always have reliable hand protection in combat. Military personnel For soldiers, a belt with a suspension system can be used to carry various military equipment. For example, during mission execution, they can use the suspension system to attach equipment such as ammunition pouches, water bottles, and walkie-talkies. The MOLLE system (Modular Lightweight Load-carrying Equipment) can conveniently adjust the position and layout of equipment to adapt to different combat tasks and personal habits. Moreover, during marches or combat, the belt's fixing system and inner layer foam can provide a certain degree of comfort and reduce the pressure on the waist caused by the weight of equipment. Law enforcement officers When police perform tasks such as patrol, counter-terrorism, and emergency response, they need to carry equipment such as handcuffs, batons, law enforcement recorders, and walkie-talkies. A belt with a suspension system can allow these equipments to be hung on the belt in an orderly manner for convenient and quick access. Best Selling Digital Camouflage view more Army Green view more Jungle Camouflage view more Kahki view more How to clean and maintain a tactical belt? --Cleaning method General stain cleaning For dust, dirt and other stains on the tactical belt, first, a clean soft brush can be used to gently brush off the dust and debris on the surface. For example, after coming back from outdoor exploration, there may be some dust and small particles on the belt. Using a soft brush can easily remove these impurities. If it is a light stain, such as sweat stains, a small amount of oil stains, etc., a mild detergent can be used for cleaning. Drop a small amount of neutral detergent (such as hand sanitizer without strong decontamination ingredients or professional fabric detergent) into warm water, then dip a clean soft cloth in the solution and gently wipe the stained area of the belt. Note that do not let the belt soak in water for a long time to avoid damaging the internal structure and material. Treatment of stubborn stains When there are stubborn stains on the tactical belt, such as dried paint, a large amount of oil stain or bloodstain, special detergents can be used. For example, for oil stains, detergents containing organic solvents can be selected, but first test on an inconspicuous small corner of the belt to ensure that it will not cause damage to the color and material of the belt. If it is stained with paint, paint thinner can be used, but also operate with caution. After using these strong detergents, wipe off the detergent with a clean wet cloth as soon as possible, then rinse with clean water, and finally let the belt air dry naturally. How to clean and maintain a tactical belt? --Maintenance points Avoid excessive use and damage In daily use, try to avoid making the tactical belt bear a weight exceeding its design load. For example, do not hang too many and overly heavy equipment on the belt to prevent the belt from deforming or the buckles from being damaged. If you need to hang heavier items, such as large radio equipment, ensure that the carrying capacity of the belt is sufficient and the weight is evenly distributed. Avoid contact between the belt and sharp objects to prevent scratches. During outdoor activities, pay attention to preventing the belt from being cut by sharp objects such as branches and rocks. When passing through thorny bushes or complex terrain, you can check the route in advance or use other protective measures (such as wrapping the belt part with clothing) to protect the belt. Regular inspection and maintenance Regularly check whether the buckle of the belt is working properly. Check whether the opening and closing of the metal buckle is smooth and whether the spring device is effective. For example, the buckle can be checked once a week to ensure that the belt can be unfastened and fastened smoothly in an emergency. Check whether the stitching part of the belt is loose or has broken threads. If there is a problem with the stitching, repair it in time. You can use thread of the same material as the belt for stitching. At the same time, also check whether the mounting points of the belt (such as hanging rings, fixed points of bags, etc.) are firm. If there is looseness, strengthen it in time. Notes on storage environment Tactical belts should be stored in a dry and well-ventilated environment. Avoid placing the belt in damp places such as basements or near bathrooms to prevent mildew and rusting of metal parts. The belt can be placed in a special equipment storage bag or a dry drawer. Before storage, make sure the belt is clean and dry. If the belt is wet, it must be dried before storage. And avoid prolonged exposure of the belt to direct sunlight, as ultraviolet rays may cause fading of the belt's color and aging of the material. Simplifying the design: Remove unnecessary decorations and functions, simplify the design of the belt, and reduce the weight of the belt. At the same time, rationally layout each component of the belt to make the belt more compact and lightweight. For example, some military belts only retain the most basic functions such as fixing pants and carrying equipment when designed, avoiding excessive decorations and complex structures, thereby reducing the weight of the belt. In conclusion, through optimization in aspects such as material selection, size and adjustment, function integration, and weight reduction, the design level of military belts can be further improved, the comfort level of soldiers can be increased, and restrictions can be reduced, providing better equipment support for soldiers when performing tasks. What are the specific impacts of different materials of tactical belts on their performance? Tactical belts have extensive applications in military, outdoor and other fields. Different materials will have a significant impact on their performance. The following will provide a detailed introduction to different materials of tactical belts and their specific impacts on performance. Nylon High strength and wear resistance：Tactical belts made of nylon material usually have high strength and wear resistance. Oriented nylon 6 sheeting for core material promises extra long life for conveyor belting. Tests by Goodall Rubber Co., Trenton, N.J., indicate that nylon-cored belting may outlast conventional belting by as much as 100% in heavy duty applications. This shows that oriented nylon 6 sheeting as the core material can bring an extremely long service life to conveyor belts. Similarly, in tactical belts, nylon material can also provide good wear resistance and a relatively long service life, making it suitable for use in harsh environments. Lightweight and flexible: Nylon belts are relatively light and easy to carry and use. At the same time, it has a certain degree of flexibility and can adapt to different body movements and postures without causing excessive restraint to the user. This makes the user more flexible and at ease when performing tactical actions or outdoor activities. Corrosion resistance: Nylon has good corrosion resistance and can resist the erosion of sweat, rain, etc. In a humid environment, nylon belts are not easy to rust or be damaged and maintain good performance. polyester Stable property：Successful application of oriented-polyester film belts has been demonstrated in the Atlas-Score, Vanguard II, and Tiros I satellite tape recorders. Better performance of recorders in future NASA meteorological satellites may be expected if polyester film is used. Fatigue resistance, high stress tolerance, uniformity, and ability to be driven by extremely small pulleys are some of the many properties which make these belts superior for use in a number of mechanical instrumentation and power transmission applications.This shows that polyester material has good fatigue resistance, high stress tolerance and uniformity, and stable performance. In tactical belts, polyester material can also provide reliable performance and is not easily deformed or damaged. Lightweight and portable: Belts made of polyester material are usually relatively thin and lightweight, making them easy to carry and store. They do not take up too much space and are suitable for occasions where one needs to travel light. Wear-resistant: Polyester material has a certain degree of wear resistance and can withstand friction and wear in daily use. Although it may not be as wear-resistant as nylon material, it can generally meet the usage requirements of tactical belts. Copper Adapt to rifling: In the military field, for projectiles fired by breech-loading guns, the belts on the outer diameter of the projectiles usually use copper material. Literature 7 points out that "For projectiles fired by breech-loading guns, there are usually one or two 'belts' tied on the outer diameter of the projectiles. The professional term is belt. It uses a material softer than the rifling of the gun barrel. Generally, copper is inlaid on the projectile." Although the "belt" here is not a tactical belt, its characteristics can be borrowed. Copper material is relatively soft and can better adapt to the shape of rifling and play a role in sealing and guiding during the firing process. In tactical belts, belts made of copper material may have better flexibility and adaptability, able to fit the body curve and provide a comfortable wearing experience. Conductivity: Copper has good conductivity and may have certain uses in some special cases. For example, in occasions where electronic equipment needs to be connected or grounded, copper belts can play a certain role. Cloth material Youthful and casual style: Literature 9 mentions that "cloth belts are generally made of silk fabric. The colors and patterns are also relatively diverse. The style is youthful and casual, and easy to match." Cloth tactical belts usually have a youthful and casual appearance and are suitable for use in some informal occasions or daily wear. It can be matched with various clothing to show individuality and fashion sense. Comfort: Cloth belts are soft and comfortable, with less irritation to the skin. When worn for a long time, cloth belts can reduce the pressure on the waist and improve the comfort of wearing. Good breathability: Cloth material has good breathability and can allow air to circulate, avoiding sweating and sultriness on the waist. This is very important for people who use tactical belts in hot environments and can reduce discomfort. Artificial leather Leather-like appearance: The material of artificial leather belts is a leather-like material. It is described in literature 9. Artificial leather tactical belts have a leather-like appearance and look relatively high-end and fashionable. It can meet some people's requirements for appearance, and at the same time, the price is relatively cheaper than leather materials. Good waterproof performance: Artificial leather has certain waterproof performance and can prevent moisture penetration to a certain extent. This makes artificial leather belts able to maintain good performance and not be easily damaged by water when used in humid environments. Easy to clean: Artificial leather belts are relatively easy to clean and can be wiped with a damp cloth or cleaned with detergent. This is very convenient for tactical belts used in harsh environments and can keep the belt clean and hygienic. In conclusion, tactical belts of different materials have their own characteristics and advantages, and the impact on their performance is also different. details.description: Description product parameters Products name Green double-layer sleeping bag with pillow Products model GCRT-125EWCE Products fabric 210T polyester waterproof calendering Lining material 190T polyester pongee Filling 510g/layer*2 hollow cotton Weight 1960g Related properties Oxford cloth compression bag, 5#t nylon double-headed double-separated zipper,double-layer straight quilting, pillow, windshield and collar. Product Brand Corhunter Sleeping bag Sleeping bag Evaluation of Waterproof and Moisture Permeable Performance of Outdoor Sleeping Bag Fabrics As the demand for outdoor exploration activities continues to grow and the overall quality requirements for outdoor activities increase, the outdoor equipment industry has developed rapidly. Outdoor sleeping bags, as equipment suitable for both men and women, young and old, and usable in various environments such as the wilderness and mountains, have seen a growing market demand. Due to the need for outdoor sleeping bags to be used in special environments, the fabric of sleeping bags has high requirements for water resistance and moisture permeability. There are many types of fabrics for outdoor sleeping bags on the market, mainly including high-density fabrics, coated fabrics, and laminated fabrics. High-density fabrics are mainly made of polyester and nylon, coated fabrics are mainly PVC and PU coated fabrics, and laminated fabrics include PU, TPU, and PTFE laminated fabrics. Currently, there are many studies on the preparation methods and properties of waterproof and moisture-permeable coatings and films in China, as well as on the water repellency and moisture permeability of ordinary cotton and wool, polyester and nylon fabrics. However, there has been no overall comparison and analysis of the performance of fabrics specifically for outdoor sleeping bags. Due to the lack of data support for the waterproof and moisture-permeable properties of outdoor sleeping bag fabrics in the market, this article investigates 20 existing outdoor sleeping bag fabrics on the market, aiming to test and evaluate the surface water repellency, water resistance, and moisture permeability of the fabrics, to provide some guidance for the preparation and selection of outdoor sleeping bag fabrics. For the surface moisture resistance of 20 kinds of fabrics The surface moisture resistance of uncalendered high-density fabrics and coated fabrics with smaller coating thickness is poor, and the water resistance rating is ≤ 3. The best surface moisture resistance rating of coated fabrics and high-density calendered fabrics reaches ≤ 4. For the water resistance of 20 kinds of fabrics The water resistance of high-density fabrics is the worst, with a minimum of only 11.33 kPa. The water resistance of coated fabrics is slightly better than that of high-density fabrics, less than 20 kPa. The water resistance of coated fabrics is significantly better than that of coated and high-density fabrics, with a maximum hydrostatic pressure of 55 kPa. For the moisture permeability of 20 kinds of fabrics The moisture permeability of high-density fabrics is generally higher than that of coatings and coated fabrics, with a maximum of 6,000 g/(m · d) or more; the moisture permeability of PVC coated fabrics in coated fabrics is less than 2000 g/(m 'd), and the moisture permeability is poor: the moisture permeability of PTE two-layer coated fabrics in coated fabrics is the best, and the moisture permeability is about 4 000g/(m' d). WINDPROOF COLLAR DESIGN Prevents cold wind from entering the sleeping bag, betterwarmth retention. Thickened hood keeps the head warm ZIPPER DESIGN Zipper at the foot, breathable and comfortable. Sewing processDetailed sewing process Easy. ZIPPER DESIGN Zipper at the hand, convenient for movement. WATER-REPELLENT FABRIC The fabric is made of210T polyester, waterproofand wear-resistant. Excellent fabric 190T polyester. Advantages of human-shaped sleeping bag Good thermal insulation Conform to the human body and reduce heat loss: Its shape is designed according to the human body contour, which can tightly wrap the body, making the gap between the body and the sleeping bag extremely small, effectively reducing the possibility of heat loss through air convection. Compared with ordinary sleeping bags, the thermal insulation effect is significantly improved by 16. Head thermal insulation design: Most human-shaped sleeping bags are equipped with a full head covering design, leaving only a ventilation opening for the face to reduce heat loss from the head. Since about forty to fifty percent or more of the body's heat is lost through the head, this design can minimize the possibility of body temperature loss and provide all-round thermal insulation for the human body. High comfort level Relatively large activity space: Although the human-shaped sleeping bag fits the human body relatively well, there is still a certain amount of space reserved at parts such as knees and elbows, which is convenient for users to perform small-scale activities such as turning over and bending legs inside the sleeping bag. There is no strong sense of restraint and it allows users to maintain a relatively comfortable sleeping posture. Comfortable material: The outer layer of the sleeping bag usually adopts soft, wear-resistant and breathable fabrics, such as tear-resistant nylon cloth, etc., which has a good touch and durability; the inner layer mostly uses skin-friendly materials such as polyester fiber, pure cotton, etc., which can bring users a comfortable skin contact experience and improve sleep quality. Convenient and practical Wearable design：Some human-shaped sleeping bags have wearable functions. Users can wear the sleeping bag like clothing and walk freely without worrying about the sleeping bag slipping or affecting their movements. They can lie down and sleep at any time during outdoor rest and continue on their journey after waking up. It is very suitable for outdoor activities such as long-distance hiking and mountaineering that require frequent rest and movement. Easy to store and carry: Most human-shaped sleeping bags are equipped with compression bags. When not in use, the sleeping bag can be compressed to a smaller volume for easy carrying in a backpack. It does not take up too much space and reduces the burden of outdoor travel. Strong safety Reduce the risk of hypothermia: The good thermal insulation performance enables the human-shaped sleeping bag to provide stable warmth for the user in a cold environment, effectively preventing the body from losing temperature, reducing the health risks caused by low temperature, and ensuring the user's life safety outdoors. Convenient for nighttime activities: When the wearable human-shaped sleeping bag needs to get up and move at night, there is no need to completely get out of the sleeping bag like a traditional sleeping bag. Just wearing the sleeping bag can move, avoiding the rapid loss of heat caused by being exposed to the cold air when leaving the sleeping bag. At the same time, it also reduces the risk of accidental falls due to not being able to see the surrounding environment clearly in the dark. Versatility Emergency rescue function: In some natural disasters or emergencies, humanoid sleeping bags can be used as emergency warm supplies to provide temporary warmth and rest places for affected people and help them through difficult times. Daily use: In addition to outdoor adventures, humanoid sleeping bags can also play a role in some special daily scenarios. For example, in cold winters when the heating at home is insufficient, humanoid sleeping bags can be used as warm "quilts". Or when taking a lunch break in the office, wearing a humanoid sleeping bag for rest is both comfortable and warm. details.description: Description product parameters Products name Disposable non-woven envelope sleeping bag Products size 190*70cm Products material 45G/M2 non-woven fabric, 190T polyester(outsourced) Lining material 45G/M2 non-woven fabric Filling 150G/M2 artificial cotton Weight 600g Related properties Polyester cloth ordinary bag, 5# nylon coded zipper, singlelayer computer S quilting thread Precautions for using outdoor sleeping bags Outdoor sleeping bags are one of the indispensable equipments for outdoor travelers. When choosing an outdoor sleeping bag, comprehensive considerations need to be given according to factors such as the environment and season of outdoor activities and personal needs to select a suitable sleeping bag. At the same time, when using a sleeping bag, it is also necessary to pay attention to keeping the sleeping bag dry, using the sleeping bag correctly, and cleaning the sleeping bag regularly to ensure the performance and service life of the sleeping bag. Choose the right sleeping bag Choose a suitable sleeping bag according to the environment and season of outdoor activities to ensure that the thermal insulation performance and waterproof performance of the sleeping bag can meet the needs. Keep the sleeping bag dry Before using a sleeping bag, make sure it is dry to avoid the impact of moisture on its thermal insulation performance. During outdoor activities, try to avoid the sleeping bag coming into contact with rain, dew, etc. Correct use of sleeping bag Use sleeping bags correctly according to the instructions, such as zipping up and adjusting the hat, etc., to improve thermal insulation performance. Regularly clean sleeping bags. Regularly clean the sleeping bag to keep it clean and hygienic and prolong its service life. Mechanical properties of fabrics for outdoor sleeping bags Taking 20 commercially available outdoor clothing fabrics as the research object, the tensile properties, tear properties and abrasion resistance of the fabrics were tested. The results show that: Tensile properties The tensile fracture resistance of laminated fabric and high-density polyester fabric is very good. The breaking strength is generally greater than 2000N. The tensile fracture property of coated fabric is moderate. The tensile resistance of high-density nylon fabric is poor. Tearing properties High-density fabrics generally have good tear resistance. The maximum tear strength exceeds 21N. The tear resistance of coated fabrics is relatively poor. Among laminated fabrics, PU and TPU fabrics have average tear resistance. PTFE laminated fabric has very poor tear resistance. Wear resistance Except for a small part of high-density fabrics, the wear resistance test times with wool abrasive for the rest of high-density fabrics are all ≥10000 times. Among laminated fabrics, the wear resistance of PU laminated fabric is very good. The wear resistance test times with sandpaper abrasive reach more than 2000 times. The wear resistance of TPU laminated fabric is moderate. PTFE laminated fabric is not wear-resistant. The wear resistance of coated fabrics is worse than that of laminated fabrics. Among them, PVC coated fabric is more wear-resistant than ordinary printed coated fabric. details.description: Description product parameters Products name Disaster relief sleeping bag Products material 210T Oxford cloth Filling material Silk cotton Product composition Sleeping bag Product lining Polyester pongee Product color Blue Product use Multifunctional sleeping bag for warmthand cold protection and disaster relief Sleeping bag Sleeping bag product parameters Thermometer scale Comfort temperature: Refers to the temperature at which an average person can obtain a comfortable sleep experience using the sleeping bag. For example, for a sleeping bag with a comfort temperature of 10℃, when the ambient temperature is close to 10℃, the user will feel relatively comfortable without being too cold or too hot. Limit temperature: Also known as the lowest temperature, it is the lowest usable temperature that the sleeping bag can withstand. When the ambient temperature is lower than this temperature, the sleeping bag may not provide sufficient warmth and the user will feel cold. For example, for a sleeping bag with a limit temperature of -5℃, when used in an environment with a temperature lower than -5℃, its warmth retention will be greatly reduced. Filling Materials Down: Down sleeping bags have advantages such as strong thermal insulation performance, light weight, and good compressibility. Generally speaking, the higher the down content, the better the thermal insulation performance. Common down contents are 70%, 80%, 90%, etc. Among them, sleeping bags with 90% down content have the best thermal insulation effect. White duck down and grey duck down are common types of down. They have little difference in thermal insulation performance, but white duck down is lighter in color and suitable for users who have requirements for color. Synthetic Fiber: Sleeping bags filled with synthetic fibers such as hollow cotton have relatively low prices and can still maintain a certain thermal insulation performance in humid environments. Although its thermal insulation effect is not as good as that of down, it has better moisture resistance and durability and is suitable for use in humid or rainy environments. Fill weight Fill weight directly affects the warmth and overall weight of a sleeping bag. Generally, the greater the fill weight, the stronger the warmth retention of the sleeping bag, but the sleeping bag will also be heavier. For example, a sleeping bag with a fill weight of 1000 grams will be warmer than a sleeping bag with a fill weight of 500 grams, but at the same time it will also be heavier and may not be so convenient to carry. Fabric Outer fabric：The outer fabric of a sleeping bag usually requires properties such as waterproofing, windproofing, and abrasion resistance. Common outer fabrics include nylon, polyester fiber, etc. For example, nylon fabrics of different specifications such as 210T and 420D. Envelope type: The shape of the envelope-type sleeping bag is relatively wide, similar to an envelope, providing a more spacious sleeping space. Users can freely turn over inside the sleeping bag. details.description: Description product parameters Products name Green double-layer sleeping bag with pillow Products model GCRT-125EWCE Products fabric 210T polyester waterproof calendering Lining material 190T polyester pongee Filling 510g/layer*2 hollow cotton Weight 1960g Related properties Oxford cloth compression bag, 5#t nylon double-headed double-separated zipper,double-layer straight quilting, pillow, windshield and collar. Product Brand Corhunter Sleeping bag Sleeping bag Evaluation of Waterproof and Moisture Permeable Performance of Outdoor Sleeping Bag Fabrics As the demand for outdoor exploration activities continues to grow and the overall quality requirements for outdoor activities increase, the outdoor equipment industry has developed rapidly. Outdoor sleeping bags, as equipment suitable for both men and women, young and old, and usable in various environments such as the wilderness and mountains, have seen a growing market demand. Due to the need for outdoor sleeping bags to be used in special environments, the fabric of sleeping bags has high requirements for water resistance and moisture permeability. There are many types of fabrics for outdoor sleeping bags on the market, mainly including high-density fabrics, coated fabrics, and laminated fabrics. High-density fabrics are mainly made of polyester and nylon, coated fabrics are mainly PVC and PU coated fabrics, and laminated fabrics include PU, TPU, and PTFE laminated fabrics. Currently, there are many studies on the preparation methods and properties of waterproof and moisture-permeable coatings and films in China, as well as on the water repellency and moisture permeability of ordinary cotton and wool, polyester and nylon fabrics. However, there has been no overall comparison and analysis of the performance of fabrics specifically for outdoor sleeping bags. Due to the lack of data support for the waterproof and moisture-permeable properties of outdoor sleeping bag fabrics in the market, this article investigates 20 existing outdoor sleeping bag fabrics on the market, aiming to test and evaluate the surface water repellency, water resistance, and moisture permeability of the fabrics, to provide some guidance for the preparation and selection of outdoor sleeping bag fabrics. For the surface moisture resistance of 20 kinds of fabrics The surface moisture resistance of uncalendered high-density fabrics and coated fabrics with smaller coating thickness is poor, and the water resistance rating is ≤ 3. The best surface moisture resistance rating of coated fabrics and high-density calendered fabrics reaches ≤ 4. For the water resistance of 20 kinds of fabrics The water resistance of high-density fabrics is the worst, with a minimum of only 11.33 kPa. The water resistance of coated fabrics is slightly better than that of high-density fabrics, less than 20 kPa. The water resistance of coated fabrics is significantly better than that of coated and high-density fabrics, with a maximum hydrostatic pressure of 55 kPa. For the moisture permeability of 20 kinds of fabrics The moisture permeability of high-density fabrics is generally higher than that of coatings and coated fabrics, with a maximum of 6,000 g/(m · d) or more; the moisture permeability of PVC coated fabrics in coated fabrics is less than 2000 g/(m 'd), and the moisture permeability is poor: the moisture permeability of PTE two-layer coated fabrics in coated fabrics is the best, and the moisture permeability is about 4 000g/(m' d). Head thermal insulation design: Most human-shaped sleeping bags are equipped with a full head covering design, leaving only a ventilation opening for the face to reduce heat loss from the head. High comfort level Relatively large activity space: Although the human-shaped sleeping bag fits the human body relatively well, there is still a certain amount of space reserved at parts such as knees and elbows, which is convenient for users to perform small-scale activities such as turning over and bending legs inside the sleeping bag. Easy to store and carry: Most human-shaped sleeping bags are equipped with compression bags. When not in use, the sleeping bag can be compressed to a smaller volume for easy carrying in a backpack. It does not take up too much space and reduces the burden of outdoor travel. Strong safety Reduce the risk of hypothermia: The good thermal insulation performance enables the human-shaped sleeping bag to provide stable warmth for the user in a cold environment, effectively preventing the body from losing temperature, reducing the health risks caused by low temperature, and ensuring the user's life safety outdoors. Convenient for nighttime activities: When the wearable human-shaped sleeping bag needs to get up and move at night, there is no need to completely get out of the sleeping bag like a traditional sleeping bag. Just wearing the sleeping bag can move, avoiding the rapid loss of heat caused by being exposed to the cold air when leaving the sleeping bag. At the same time, it also reduces the risk of accidental falls due to not being able to see the surrounding environment clearly in the dark. Versatility Emergency rescue function: In some natural disasters or emergencies, humanoid sleeping bags can be used as emergency warm supplies to provide temporary warmth and rest places for affected people and help them through difficult times. Daily use: In addition to outdoor adventures, humanoid sleeping bags can also play a role in some special daily scenarios. When choosing an outdoor sleeping bag, comprehensive considerations need to be given according to factors such as the environment and season of outdoor activities and personal needs to select a suitable sleeping bag. At the same time, when using a sleeping bag, it is also necessary to pay attention to keeping the sleeping bag dry, using the sleeping bag correctly, and cleaning the sleeping bag regularly to ensure the performance and service life of the sleeping bag. Choose the right sleeping bag Choose a suitable sleeping bag according to the environment and season of outdoor activities to ensure that the thermal insulation performance and waterproof performance of the sleeping bag can meet the needs. Keep the sleeping bag dry Before using a sleeping bag, make sure it is dry to avoid the impact of moisture on its thermal insulation performance. Regularly clean sleeping bags. Regularly clean the sleeping bag to keep it clean and hygienic and prolong its service life. Mechanical properties of fabrics for outdoor sleeping bags Taking 20 commercially available outdoor clothing fabrics as the research object, the tensile properties, tear properties and abrasion resistance of the fabrics were tested. The results show that: Tensile properties The tensile fracture resistance of laminated fabric and high-density polyester fabric is very good. The breaking strength is generally greater than 2000N. The tensile fracture property of coated fabric is moderate. The tensile resistance of high-density nylon fabric is poor. Tearing properties High-density fabrics generally have good tear resistance. The maximum tear strength exceeds 21N. The tear resistance of coated fabrics is relatively poor. Among laminated fabrics, PU and TPU fabrics have average tear resistance. PTFE laminated fabric has very poor tear resistance. Wear resistance Except for a small part of high-density fabrics, the wear resistance test times with wool abrasive for the rest of high-density fabrics are all ≥10000 times. Among laminated fabrics, the wear resistance of PU laminated fabric is very good. The wear resistance test times with sandpaper abrasive reach more than 2000 times. The wear resistance of TPU laminated fabric is moderate. PTFE laminated fabric is not wear-resistant. The wear resistance of coated fabrics is worse than that of laminated fabrics. Among them, PVC coated fabric is more wear-resistant than ordinary printed coated fabric. details.description: Description product parameters Products name Disaster relief sleeping bag Products material 210T Oxford cloth Filling material Silk cotton Product composition Sleeping bag Product lining Polyester pongee Product color Blue Product use Multifunctional sleeping bag for warmthand cold protection and disaster relief Sleeping bag Sleeping bag product parameters Thermometer scale Comfort temperature: Refers to the temperature at which an average person can obtain a comfortable sleep experience using the sleeping bag. For example, for a sleeping bag with a comfort temperature of 10℃, when the ambient temperature is close to 10℃, the user will feel relatively comfortable without being too cold or too hot. Limit temperature: Also known as the lowest temperature, it is the lowest usable temperature that the sleeping bag can withstand. When the ambient temperature is lower than this temperature, the sleeping bag may not provide sufficient warmth and the user will feel cold. For example, for a sleeping bag with a limit temperature of -5℃, when used in an environment with a temperature lower than -5℃, its warmth retention will be greatly reduced. Filling Materials Down: Down sleeping bags have advantages such as strong thermal insulation performance, light weight, and good compressibility. Generally speaking, the higher the down content, the better the thermal insulation performance. Common down contents are 70%, 80%, 90%, etc. Among them, sleeping bags with 90% down content have the best thermal insulation effect. White duck down and grey duck down are common types of down. They have little difference in thermal insulation performance, but white duck down is lighter in color and suitable for users who have requirements for color. Synthetic Fiber: Sleeping bags filled with synthetic fibers such as hollow cotton have relatively low prices and can still maintain a certain thermal insulation performance in humid environments. Although its thermal insulation effect is not as good as that of down, it has better moisture resistance and durability and is suitable for use in humid or rainy environments. Fill weight Fill weight directly affects the warmth and overall weight of a sleeping bag. Generally, the greater the fill weight, the stronger the warmth retention of the sleeping bag, but the sleeping bag will also be heavier. For example, a sleeping bag with a fill weight of 1000 grams will be warmer than a sleeping bag with a fill weight of 500 grams, but at the same time it will also be heavier and may not be so convenient to carry. Fabric Outer fabric：The outer fabric of a sleeping bag usually requires properties such as waterproofing, windproofing, and abrasion resistance. Common outer fabrics include nylon, polyester fiber, etc. For example, nylon fabrics of different specifications such as 210T and 420D. The larger the number, the thicker the fabric and the stronger the abrasion resistance. Inner fabric: The inner fabric pays more attention to softness, comfort, and breathability to provide a good sleeping experience. Common inner fabrics include cotton, silk, etc. Cotton fabric is soft and comfortable, has strong moisture absorption, but a slower drying speed; silk fabric is smoother and softer, has good breathability, but is relatively more expensive. apacity Mummy type: This shape of sleeping bag can fit the human body closely, reducing heat loss and having excellent thermal insulation. Its head is relatively narrow, and the feet gradually become narrower, which can effectively reduce air circulation and keep the body warm. However, the mummy-type sleeping bag has relatively small space for movement and is not very suitable for people who like to turn over frequently during sleep. Envelope type: The shape of the envelope-type sleeping bag is relatively wide, similar to an envelope, providing a more spacious sleeping space. Users can freely turn over inside the sleeping bag. Its thermal insulation performance is slightly worse than that of the mummy-type sleeping bag, but it has higher comfort and is suitable for use in relatively warm environments or for users with high requirements for sleeping comfort. In 1936, Motorola developed the first mobile radio communication product - the "Patrol" AM car radio receiver. Then, in 1940, it developed the first handheld two-way radio AM walkie-talkie weighing 2.2 kg for the US Army Signal Corps, with a communication distance of 1.6 km. In 1962, Motorola launched the first handheld wireless walkie-talkie weighing only 935g, the HT200, which was called "brick" and was similar in size to the early Big Brother mobile phone. When there is network support, the call distance of the walkie-talkie can reach tens of kilometers. The factors that affect the call distance and effect of the walkie-talkie include the following aspects: 1. System parameters: The stronger the transmitter output power, the greater the coverage of the transmitted signal. The higher the reception sensitivity of the communication machine, the farther the communication distance will be. The gain of the antenna, when the antenna is matched with the machine, usually, the antenna height is increased, and the receiving or transmitting ability is enhanced. The antenna used in handheld walkie-talkies is generally a spiral antenna, which has a smaller bandwidth and gain than other types of antennas and is more susceptible to human influence. 2. Environmental factors: Environmental factors mainly include path, tree density, environmental electromagnetic interference, buildings, weather conditions, and topographic differences. These factors and other parameters directly affect the field strength and coverage of the signal. 3. Other influencing factors: The battery is low. When the battery is low, the call quality will deteriorate. In severe cases, there will be noise, which will affect normal calls. Antenna matching. The quality of the sound mainly depends on the pre-emphasis and de-emphasis circuit, as well as the more advanced speech processing circuit "the application of speech diffuser circuit and low-level expansion circuit", which has a good effect on fidelity speech. The factors that affect the distance and effectiveness of walkie-talkie calls are also related to the season, with summer being better than winter. Walkie-talkie application scenarios Walkie-talkie application scenarios Products Description After nearly a century of development, the application of walkie-talkie has become very common, and it has moved from specialized fields to ordinary consumption, and expanded from military use to civilian use. It is not only a professional wireless communication tool in mobile communication, but also a consumer tool with the characteristics of consumer products that can meet the needs of people's lives. Walkie-talkie is an end-point device for multi-point communication, which allows many people to communicate with each other at the same time, but only one person can speak at the same time. Compared with other communication methods, this communication method is characterized by: instant communication, one call and 100 responses, economical and practical, low operating cost, no call cost, easy to use, and also has functions such as multicast, system call, and confidential call. In dealing with emergency emergencies or conducting dispatch and command, its role cannot be replaced by other communication tools. Most of the traditional walkie-talkies use simplex analog communication methods, some walkie-talkies use frequency division duplex analog communication methods, and digital walkie-talkies are used more in cluster communication, but most of them are frequency division duplex methods. The market positioning of radio walkie-talkies and other wireless communication tools (such as mobile phones) is different, and it is difficult to replace each other. Radio walkie-talkies are by no means outdated products, and they will be used for a long time. With the development of the economy and the progress of society, people pay more attention to their own safety, work efficiency and quality of life, and the demand for radio walkie-talkies will also increase day by day. The extensive use of walkie-talkies by the public has further promoted radio walkie-talkies to become a communication tool that people love and rely on. interphone performance index 1 Frequency Error The difference between the unmodulated carrier frequency and the assigned frequency. 2 output carrier power The average power of the transmitter rack to the transmission line in an RF cycle without modulation. 3 stray RF component In addition to the modulation component near the carrier wave and its transmission bandwidth, a signal that has a significant component at discrete frequencies or in narrow bands, including harmonic, non-harmonic, and parasitic components. 4 Adjacent channel power The portion of the total output power of a transmitter operating in a channel-divided system that falls within the specified bandwidth of any adjacent channel under specified modulation conditions. 5 Audio distortion The ratio of the root mean square value of the distorted sine signal excluding its fundamental component to the root mean square value of the full signal, expressed as a percentage, the distorted sine signal includes harmonic components, power supply ripple, and non-harmonic components. 6 modulation limit The ability of the transmitter audio circuit to prevent modulation from exceeding the maximum allowable offset. 7 Rated audio output power The power available when the receiver is under specified operating conditions and its output is connected to a specified load. 8 Reference Sensitivity Also known as Maximum Available Sensitivity, at a specified frequency and modulation, the input signal level of the received output generates a standard signal to noise ratio (12 dBSINAD). 9 Selectivity Characterizes the ability of a receiver's useful input signal to resist unwanted input signals.
