Waterproof and breathable membrane technology for raincoats At present, there are many common waterproof and breathable membrane technologies for raincoats. Among them, chemical coating technology is to add coatings on fabrics. For example, fabrics usually include oxford cloth, polyester, nylon, etc., and coatings usually include PVC, PU, EVA, etc. The coating can prevent water molecules from entering the fabric, and the fabric can increase the strength and durability of the coating. PU coating is one of the common treatment methods. Coating a layer of polyurethane coating on the fabric makes it form a waterproof film, which has good waterproof performance while maintaining breathability. PTFE membrane, that is, polytetrafluoroethylene membrane, is also a commonly used waterproof treatment. It has extremely high waterproof performance and can maintain the breathability of the fabric. Wax coating can be used for natural fibers such as cotton fabrics to fill the gaps between fibers and prevent rainwater from penetrating. The hot-pressing adhesive layer is formed by hot-pressing two layers of fabrics or films to form a tightly bonded waterproof layer.. Waterproof and breathable membrane technology for raincoats Some high-performance raincoats also adopt microporous film technology, such as Gore-Tex and eVent. Gore-Tex is a famous waterproof and breathable film material with a microporous structure. It can prevent liquid water from penetrating and at the same time allow moisture in the body to escape. It can provide good breathability while keeping the interior dry. eVent also uses special microporous technology to effectively prevent rainwater from entering and at the same time allow moisture in the body to escape. In addition, there is a fluorine-free waterproof and breathable membrane. A fluorine-free waterproofing agent with acrylic polymer dispersion as the main component has excellent water repellency, anti-siphoning and waterproof stain resistance. It can be used for waterproof finishing of outdoor clothing fabrics such as jackets, and can also be used for waterproof finishing of outdoor products such as down feathers, tent cloth, raincoats and rain gear. This waterproof and breathable membrane has a simple processing technology. Padding, dipping and spraying processes are all applicable and environmentally friendly. FAQ Q: What are the chemical coating technologies for raincoats? A: The chemical coating technology of raincoats is diverse and provides effective waterproof performance for raincoats. Common coating technologies include the use of fluorine-containing coatings. For example, fluorine-based waterproofing agents such as carbon six waterproofing agent and carbon eight waterproofing agent can endow clothing fabrics with oil-proof performance, but may have a certain impact on the environment. There is also a fluorine-free waterproofing agent coating technology. For example, Texnology®M380 developed by Guangzhou Lianzhuang Technology is a high-performance and environmentally friendly fluorine-free waterproofing agent synthesized from modified resin. The clothing fabric treated with it has excellent water repellency, anti-siphon performance, and easily achieves a waterproof score of 100. It can protect clothing from being splashed by rainwater, has excellent performance in protecting against water-based stains, makes clothing easy to clean locally, and has good washability. After being washed many times, it still has excellent protection performance. In addition, there is a waterproof coating for raincoats, which is made of waterborne polyurethane, hexafluoroethylene, polyacrylic acid, phenolic resin, antioxidant, modified polyurethane resin, phthalic acid diester, polyphosphoric acid amine, silane coupling agent, crosslinking agent and other raw materials, providing good waterproof effect for raincoats. Q: Application of PTFE film in raincoats A: The hot-pressed adhesive layer plays a crucial role in raincoats. The hot-pressed adhesive layer is formed by subjecting two layers of fabric or film to hot-pressing treatment to create a tightly bonded waterproof layer. For example, the Fengmi Storm Coat 3.0 adopts hot-pressing sealing technology for full garment waterproofing. The wiring parts of the clothes are subjected to hot-pressing treatment so that rainwater will not leak in through the seams and wet the clothes. After hot-pressing and sealing, Corhunter raincoats are all subjected to water pressure resistance tests to avoid water seepage at the seams. The Polyester pongee double-layer raincoat workwear set uses PU environmentally friendly coating and is hot-pressed and sealed at 700 degrees at the seams to effectively prevent leakage. Some outdoor products such as medical protective clothing, waterproof clothing, waterproof shoes, tents, etc. will also use hot-pressed waterproof strips. By using the pressurization principle of hot air nozzles and upper and lower rollers, the waterproof adhesive strips are tightly attached to the seams to achieve a good waterproof effect. Q: Material characteristics of Gore-Tex waterproof and breathable membrane. A: Gore-Tex waterproof and breathable membrane is a high-performance material manufactured by W. L. Gore & Associates in the United States. Through its microporous structure, it achieves high waterproofing while allowing sweat vapor molecules to escape, thereby keeping the wearer dry and comfortable. The Gore-Tex film is made of ePTFE (polytetrafluoroethylene) material. The internal structure has countless micropores. The diameter of these micropores can allow water vapor generated after sweating to be discharged while blocking water droplets from entering, thus achieving the effect of being windproof, waterproof, and breathable. Gore-Tex fabrics generally have a two-layer or three-layer structure. The two-layer structure directly bonds the waterproof and breathable membrane to the fabric. The three-layer fabric has an inner lining on the inside of the waterproof and breathable membrane to prevent abrasion. The former is lighter and more breathable, while the latter is more durable and has better waterproof and windproof performance. The three-layer Gore-Tex fabric that uses GORE®C-Knit Backer Technology represents that its inner side is a knitted lining, which is lighter in weight and has better breathability. Gore-Tex is known as the "canvas of the century." The comprehensive performance of its products in terms of durability and abrasion resistance in harsh weather and environments is currently the most reliable. There are various waterproof and breathable membrane technologies for raincoats, providing effective protection for people in different usage scenarios. Gore-Tex and eVent, as representatives of high-performance waterproof and breathable membrane technologies, are widely used in the field of outdoor clothing. They achieve a balance between waterproofing and breathability through special microporous structures. The application of PTFE membrane materials in raincoats provides stable performance and good waterproof and breathable effects. The hot melt adhesive layer further improves the waterproof performance of raincoats by closely bonding the fabric and preventing rainwater from seeping in through the seams. The use of fluorine-free waterproof agents provides an environmentally friendly waterproof solution for raincoats. The continuous development and innovation of these technologies bring more convenience and comfort to people's lives. details.description: Description Flame Blue Raincoat Suit Quality is reflected in the details Pay attention to every detail Raincoat double placket Waterproof double cuffs Breathable mesh lining Products show The waterproof and breathable principle of raincoat Waterproof principle Fabric characteristics: The fabric of raincoat is usually specially treated to have waterproof function. For example, fabrics such as polyvinyl chloride (PVC), nylon plus polyvinyl chloride, waterproof and breathable fabric, etc., can form a waterproof film on the surface to prevent rainwater from penetrating. Coating technology: Apply a waterproof coating such as PU, PVC, etc. on the surface of the fabric to increase the waterproof performance of the fabric. These coatings can fill the pores of the fabric to form a waterproof layer that prevents rainwater from penetrating. Non-wetting phenomenon: When raindrops on the surface of the raincoat, small water droplets will form and roll down quickly. This is because the attraction of rubber molecules to water molecules is much smaller than the attraction between water molecules. Water molecules tend to gather together and roll down along the surface of the raincoat. Tight weaving: Some raincoat fabrics are tightly woven to reduce the pores of the fabric, thereby improving the waterproof performance. Breathable principle Microporous structure: Some raincoat fabrics have microporous structures. The size of these micropores is smaller than that of liquid water molecules, but larger than that of gaseous water molecules. In this way, rainwater cannot penetrate into the inside of the raincoat, while the sweat emitted by the human body can be discharged through the micropores, thus achieving the breathable function. Breathable membrane: Some high-end raincoats use breathable membrane technology, such as GORE-TEX. The breathable membrane has a special molecular structure that can prevent rainwater from penetrating while allowing sweat to pass through, thereby achieving a waterproof and breathable effect. Ventilation design: The design of the raincoat will also take ventilation factors into consideration, and increase air circulation and improve breathability by designing vents and air holes. Raincoat waterproof breathable membrane technology 1.Principle Microporous structure: There are a large number of extremely tiny pores or micropores on the waterproof and breathable membrane. These micropores are so small that liquid water droplets cannot pass through, but water vapor molecules can pass freely. Because the diameter of water vapor molecules is much smaller than that of liquid water molecules, when the water vapor produced by human sweating exists in a gaseous state, it can smoothly pass through these micropores and be emitted to the outside world, while the external rainwater is blocked outside the membrane, thus achieving the dual functions of waterproofing and breathability. Surface tension effect: When rainwater comes into contact with the waterproof and breathable membrane, due to the surface tension of water, the rainwater will form water droplets and roll on the surface of the membrane instead of seeping into the membrane. Moreover, even if a small amount of water vapor condenses into water droplets outside the membrane, due to the relatively large size of the water droplets, they cannot pass through the micropores and enter the inside of the membrane again, further ensuring the waterproof performance of the membrane. 2.Structure Usually, the waterproof and breathable membrane does not exist alone but is used in combination with other materials. Generally, on the basis of one or more layers of fabric, the waterproof and breathable membrane is closely combined with the fabric through special processes. For example, in some cases, the waterproof and breathable membrane is sandwiched between two layers of fabric, forming a sandwich structure; in other cases, the membrane is directly attached to the inside or outside of the fabric. Such a composite structure not only ensures the overall strength and durability of the raincoat but also fully exerts the functions of the waterproof and breathable membrane. 3.Materials:There are many kinds of materials used to make waterproof and breathable membranes, and common ones include polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) and thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU). Polytetrafluoroethylene: This material has excellent chemical stability, corrosion resistance, and high - temperature resistance. The microporous structure of the waterproof and breathable membrane made of it is uniform and stable, and its waterproof and breathable performance is excellent. It is a commonly used material for high - end waterproof and breathable products. Thermoplastic polyurethane: TPU material has good elasticity and flexibility, good processing performance, and a relatively low price. It is widely used in some mid - to - low - end waterproof and breathable raincoats. In conclusion, the waterproof and breathable membrane technology is an important technology in raincoat manufacturing. It overcomes the drawback of traditional raincoats that are waterproof but not breathable, providing people with a more comfortable wearing experience on rainy days. Raincoat Detail Raincoat Detail Standards and Certification of Raincoats International Standards 1 ISO Standards: The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) has formulated a series of standards related to raincoats. For example, the ISO 20345 standard involves general requirements for personal protective equipment (including waterproof clothing such as raincoats), including aspects such as material performance, design, and test methods. Following these standards can enable raincoats to gain wider recognition in the international market. 2 AATCC Standards (American Association of Textile Chemists and Colorists Standards): There are detailed regulations on aspects such as color fastness and waterproof and breathable performance of raincoats. For example, the AATCC 127 standard is used to test the hydrostatic pressure resistance of fabrics. Raincoats that pass this standard test have a certain quality guarantee in waterproof performance. Chinese Standards 1 GB Standards (National Standards): Standards such as GB/T 23316 - 2009 "Requirements and test methods for antistatic properties of work clothes" in China have clear regulations on aspects such as antistatic performance, waterproof performance, and breathable performance of raincoats. Raincoats that meet national standards meet the basic domestic market demand in terms of quality and performance. 2 Industry Standards: In the textile and clothing industries, there are also industry standards for raincoats. These standards have more detailed specifications in aspects such as raincoat production technology, quality control, and product classification, and play an important role in regulating the raincoat market and protecting consumer rights. Certification Marks 1 CE Certification (European Conformity Certification): In the European market, if a raincoat has the CE certification mark, it indicates that the product meets the basic requirements of relevant EU directives and harmonized standards, covering multiple aspects such as health, safety, and environmental protection. For example, for raincoats with protective functions, CE certification ensures that they meet the specified standards in protective performance. 2 UL Certification (Underwriters Laboratories Certification): This is one of the most authoritative certifications in the United States. Although UL certification is not specifically for raincoats, for some raincoats with special functions (such as flame retardant, antistatic, etc.), obtaining UL certification can increase the credibility and market competitiveness of the product. Raincoat selection skills 1. Look at the parameter introduction The parameter label of the raincoat will have the waterproof performance, breathability, friction resistance, drying performance, environmental protection performance and size of the raincoat. See if the above performance meets the national standards, or compare it with other raincoats to see which one has a higher cost performance. 2. Consider the purpose and scene If it is used occasionally to avoid rain and waterproof, and the pursuit of raincoats is not high, you can choose a raincoat made of lower-priced polyester, PU, ​​PE, nylon (nylon) and other materials. If you pay more attention to experience, pursue comfort, and have higher requirements for raincoats, you can choose a raincoat made of waterproof and breathable cloth. If you are pursuing a higher experience and higher requirements, you can choose a raincoat made of more expensive Gore-Tex fabric. 3. Functional design High-quality design will take into account the fit of the raincoat and the safety of the user to ensure freedom of movement during cycling or outdoor sports, reduce wind resistance, and provide good vision. There are also reflective strips designed on the front and back of the raincoat to increase safety at night or when the vision is poor. 4. Style design Depending on the overall design, raincoats can also be divided into ponchos, one-pieces, and split types. Ponchos are the most common raincoats, suitable for short rainy days or quick dressing and taking off. One-piece raincoats have a longer top that hangs down to the knees or even below, and are usually suitable for cycling and walking; split raincoats have separate tops and pants, which can be worn separately like ordinary clothes. Suitable for outdoor hiking, fishing, etc. 5. Look at the workmanship The workmanship of a raincoat is very important. If the stitch length of a raincoat is too large, the stitch height is inconsistent, the sealing is not up to standard, and no anti-penetration treatment is used, it will easily leak water when encountering heavy rain or rainstorms. High collar design, neck protection The collar is high collar design, and the left and right tongues are connected by magic adhesive to prevent rain from seeping in and effectively protect the neck. product parameter Fabric Material Title PVC PU Oxford cloth PU Parameter Thickness: Common thicknesses range from 0.1 - 0.3mm. For example, the PVC thickness of a regular disposable raincoat may be around 0.1mm, while a high-quality, reusable PVC raincoat may be 0.2 - 0.3mm thick. Thickness directly affects the durability and waterproofness of the raincoat. Thicker PVC materials are more wear-resistant and puncture-resistant, but they also make the raincoat heavier. Density: Generally measured in grams per cubic meter (g/m³). PVC materials with higher density have more tightly arranged molecules and better waterproof properties. High-quality PVC raincoat materials can have a density of 1380 - 1450g/m³. Coating thickness: PU coatings are usually thin, generally 0.01 - 0.05mm. Coating thickness affects waterproof and breathable properties. Too thin a coating may not be waterproof enough, while too thick a coating may affect breathability. Adhesion: Indicates how tightly the PU coating is bonded to the base fabric, measured in Newtons per meter (N/m). Good adhesion can prevent the coating from falling off, and the adhesion of a high-quality PU coating to the fabric can reach 5 - 10N/m. Thread count: Common thread counts range from 210D to 1680D. For example, 210D Oxford fabric is relatively thin and light, and is often used for lightweight raincoats, while 1680D Oxford fabric is thick and strong, and is suitable for making outdoor durable raincoats. The higher the thread count, the tighter and stronger the fabric. Density index: Usually expressed in terms of the number of warp and weft yarns per inch. Oxford fabrics with high density are more wear-resistant and have better tear resistance. Generally, the warp and weft density of high-quality Oxford fabrics can reach more than 60×60. Vinyl acetate content: The content ranges from 10% to 40%. Different vinyl acetate contents affect EVA's softness, elasticity, and cold resistance. The higher the content, the softer and more elastic the material is, but the cost is also higher. Hardness: Measured by Shore hardness, generally between 30 and 90. EVA with lower hardness is more comfortable for raincoats, while EVA with higher hardness is stiffer and has better shape retention. Waterproof Parameter Hydrostatic pressure Value range: The unit is millimeter water column (mmH₂O). The hydrostatic pressure of general raincoats is required to reach 1000-2000mmH₂O to be effectively waterproof. The hydrostatic pressure of high-quality professional outdoor raincoats can exceed 5000mmH₂O, which means that it can withstand greater water pressure without leaking, such as in heavy rain or long-term immersion in water. Test method: Fix the raincoat on a special test device, gradually increase the water pressure on the surface of the raincoat until water seeps out, and the water pressure value recorded at this time is the hydrostatic pressure. Waterproof level International standard classification: Usually according to ISO standards, the waterproof level ranges from 0 to 4. Level 0 means completely non-waterproof, and level 4 means that it can remain waterproof under various severe rainfall conditions. For example, a general daily raincoat with a waterproof level of 3 can meet the needs, while a professional outdoor adventure raincoat should reach level 4. Domestic industry standard classification: my country also has its own industry standards, which are divided into several levels, including non-waterproof, slightly waterproof, moderately waterproof, highly waterproof and super waterproof, corresponding to different waterproof indicators and application scenarios. Breathability Parameter Air permeability Unit and value: The unit of air permeability is grams per square meter per day (g/m²・d). The air permeability of ordinary raincoats may be 1000-3000g/m²・d, while the air permeability of raincoats using special breathable technology (such as microporous breathable membrane) can reach 5000-10000g/m²・d or more. The higher the air permeability, the easier it is for the heat and water vapor generated by the human body to be discharged from the raincoat. Test conditions: Under standard temperature (generally 23℃) and humidity (generally 50%), a special air permeability tester is used to measure the water vapor mass that passes through a unit area of ​​raincoat per unit time. Moisture permeability Calculation formula and standard value: Moisture permeability = (water vapor mass permeated / test area × test time) × 100%. Industry standards generally require that the moisture permeability of raincoats should not be less than 30%. The moisture permeability of high-quality raincoats can reach 50% - 70%. The higher the moisture permeability, the better the breathability of the raincoat. product detail Hot Tags: Camouflage poncho raincoat, China Camouflage poncho raincoat manufacturers, suppliers, factory, multi-purpose coat security coat, quick drying security guard clothing, high visibility stretch reflective strap, high quality security multi function coat, high quality tactical security uniforms short sleeves, high quality half finger military tactical camo gloves Previous: Blue Oxford Waterproof Raincoat For Men Next: High Visibility Safety RainCoats For Men

In addition, the price of polyester fiber mosquito nets is relatively affordable and has a good mosquito repellent effect. Nylon: The wear resistance of nylon mosquito nets ranks among the top among all kinds of fibers, and it has good elastic recovery ability and is not easy to deform. Its texture is relatively light, so that the mosquito net as a whole does not give people a heavy feeling, and its breathability is relatively good. Cotton: Cotton mosquito nets are one of the most natural and environmentally friendly choices. It has excellent breathability, allowing air to circulate fully in the mosquito net, giving people a comfortable sleeping experience. In addition, cotton fibers have good skin-friendliness, are soft to the touch, and do not irritate the skin. However, cotton mosquito nets are relatively heavy and need to be moisture-proof, otherwise they are prone to mold. 02 Mesh density The mesh of a mosquito net is measured by the number of holes per square centimeter. Generally speaking, the mesh density of an ordinary mosquito net is around 20-40 holes/square centimeter, which can effectively prevent most mosquitoes from entering the mosquito net. For some special environments or users with higher requirements for mosquito prevention, they may choose a mosquito net with a higher mesh density. For example, the mesh density of some outdoor mosquito nets can reach 60-80 holes/square centimeter, which can prevent smaller mosquitoes from entering. 03 Shape Square mosquito net: This is the most common shape of mosquito net. The advantages are simple structure, can fit closely with the shape of the bed, high space utilization, and suitable for both single and double beds. Installation is also relatively convenient, and the four corners can be directly fixed on the four corners of the bed, with good stability. Circular mosquito net: The appearance is more beautiful, usually with a central support point, and the net spreads out from the center to the surroundings. It has a better sense of space and no obvious corners. It is generally suitable for a bed placed in the center of the room, and installation may require more skills. Yurt mosquito net: The shape is similar to a yurt, with a round top and vertical downwards on all sides. The advantage of this mosquito net is good stability. Due to its unique shape, it can be independently supported even without a bed frame fixed, and it is not easy to tip over. It can also be moved at any time as needed, and is flexible to use. 04 Door opening method Zipper type: the most common door opening method. The splinter camouflage pattern consists of various shades of green, brown, and black, and is designed to blend in with woodland environments. The jacket is made from a durable, water-resistant fabric and features a high collar, a full-length front zipper, and a buttoned storm flap to keep out wind and rain. The cuffs are adjustable with buttons, and the waist can be cinched in for a more fitted look. The jacket also has several pockets for storing items such as gloves, maps, or a small first aid kit. There are two large chest pockets with button closures, two front pockets with flap closures, and two zippered pockets on the upper arms. Overall, the Original Swedish Army M90 jacket is a functional and rugged piece of outerwear that is designed to withstand harsh weather conditions and heavy use. It is ideal for outdoor activities such as camping, hiking, and hunting, as well as for military and law enforcement personnel who need a reliable and camouflaged uniform. description: Company Overview: We are a professional clothing manufacturing factory dedicated to providing high-quality customized school uniforms for schools and educational institutions. With years of production experience and a specialized team, we can meet your personalized requirements for uniform styles, sizes, and colors. Target Audience: Our uniforms are suitable for students of all levels, from elementary school to high school. We offer a range of sizes and styles to ensure each student finds a comfortable fit. Whether for daily classes, group activities, or special occasions, our uniforms embody elegance and neatness.

details.description: Description Products Feature Custom Emblem and Badge: We offer custom designs for your exclusive team emblems and school badges. Whether you seek classic uniform styles or wish to showcase your school's unique characteristics through customization, we can meet your needs. Our styles are suitable for all four seasons, including short-sleeve and long-sleeve polo shirts, sweaters, windbreakers, shorts, and trousers. Size Customization: Our standard sizes range from 100cm to 190cm, and we also support customization based on students' actual measurements to ensure a comfortable and well-fitted uniform for every student, from elementary to high school. Color Diversity: According to your requirements, we offer a wide range of color options that can be customized to match your school's color scheme or students' preferences. We use durable dyes to ensure colors remain vibrant over time. Fabric Selection: We use high-quality fabrics such as cotton and polyester to ensure our uniforms are breathable, comfortable, and withstand daily wear and washing. Exquisite Craftsmanship: Each uniform undergoes meticulous cutting and stitching, and rigorous quality control to ensure it meets the highest standards in appearance and wearing experience. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Blue strips short sleeve shirt Product size Can be customized Product fabric 100% cotton Product style Uniforms Color Customized Logo on t-shirt Embroidery or printing logo as request Samples Free samples for stock Products Feature How to choose a suitable airline captain shirt Choosing a high-quality airline uniform shirt involves considering several factors, including fabric, design, craftsmanship, and fit. Fabric Selection: - Cotton: Cotton is widely regarded as the most skin-friendly option. It feels soft, is non-irritating, and offers good moisture-wicking and breathability. As a natural plant fiber, its softness and comfort are well-recognized. - Wool: Wool shirts are advantageous in winter, providing ample warmth and a certain level of sophistication, making them suitable for commuting and casual settings. - Plaid or Checked Cotton: Typically made from dyed and bleached cotton yarns woven together, these shirts have strong design appeal and are suitable for layering or as outerwear, avoiding a plain appearance. Design Considerations: - Simplify Design Elements: Avoid excessive trendy elements such as cutouts or 3D floral designs, which can make the shirt look overly complicated and hard to pair. - Cautious with Letter Prints: Especially avoid large letters or prominent logos, as these fashion elements can make the shirt appear too casual or street-style, losing its classic appeal. Craftsmanship: - Collar Quality: The collar's stiffness is a key indicator of shirt quality. A high-quality shirt should have a flexible collar stay to keep the collar straight, enhancing the overall appearance and elegance of the shirt. - Button Quality: The choice of buttons is also crucial. High-quality shirts should use premium buttons, avoiding plastic ones to elevate the shirt's overall grade. - Avoid Short Sleeves and Chest Pockets: It is best to avoid shirts with short sleeves or chest pockets. Fit: - Classic Shoulder Fit: A classic shoulder fit is ideal for airline work uniforms, as it conveys a mature and sophisticated look appropriate for formal settings. In summary, selecting a high-quality shirt requires a comprehensive consideration of fabric, design, craftsmanship, and fit to ensure that the shirt is not only stylish but also comfortable and suitable for various occasions. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Hotel uniforms Product size S-5XL (8 sizes)Can be customized Product fabric Polyester Product style Waiter uniforms Color Customized Logo on t-shirt Embroidery or printing logo as request Samples Free samples for stock Products Feature Design Principles and Considerations for Hotel Uniforms The design of hotel uniforms differs from fashion design in that it embodies a combination of practicality and artistry. The approach to design often varies depending on the type of the industry. When designing for hotels, it's important to consider the wearer's environment and job function requirements, emphasizing both distinctiveness and practicality. The design should strike a balance between noticeable differentiation and good uniformity. Hotel uniforms should harmonize with the hotel's regional characteristics. Regardless of the type of hotel, guests will first perceive regional differences and local customs. As a window to the city's or region's image, the hotel should consciously convey local culture and customs through the design of its uniforms, establishing a sense of familiarity with guests. The design process should also consider contemporary fashion trends and international dressing conventions. Uniforms should reflect the hotel's style. In shaping the overall hotel image, uniforms play a crucial role. Modern hotels are no longer just about dining and accommodation; they have expanded to include leisure, entertainment, business, and vacation types, each with diverse styles. As guest needs vary, the design of uniforms must reflect different styles to meet various psychological demands, with the form of the attire being fundamental. Different styles often express different characters and personalities. For example: In vacation or tourist hotels, where guests have strong leisure needs, the design of front desk or dining staff uniforms should be youthful, lively, and reflect leisure, entertainment, and fun. These designs should convey vitality and energy, appearing brisk and dynamic. Elegant styles, typically used for evening wear, embody grace, dignity, and nobility, suitable for mature women and social occasions. Such designs are often used for front desk receptionists or dining staff in vacation hotels. For business hotels, the primary guest requirement is convenience, and everything should reflect efficiency and accuracy. Staff attire should be formal, conservative, with moderate makeup, and of a neutral style. The design should be simple and widely acceptable, without notable age boundaries, appearing plain and unremarkable. Mature styles, characterized by elegant proportions and a youthful yet not childish appearance, often leave a distinguished impression. This design style is suitable for hotel supervisors and above, as well as for staff in public relations, human resources, and finance departments, reflecting the hotel's sense of order and professionalism. Fabric Since cleaning staff deal with a lot of stains, the fabric for cleaning uniforms should prioritize cleanliness and stain resistance. Nylon (or polyamide) fabric is ideal as it is lightweight, durable, and easy to clean. Cotton is also a good option due to its breathability and sweat-wicking properties, making it especially suitable for summer cleaning uniforms. 2. Style While comfort and practicality are crucial for cleaning uniforms, the style also needs to be aesthetically pleasing. Cleaning staff can be found in various locations, and their appearance in places like hotels reflects both their personal image and the company's image and standards. A well-designed cleaning uniform can enhance the overall image of the enterprise. 3. Color For cleaning uniforms, it's best to choose colors like beige, khaki, blue, or gray. Typically, the upper part is in a lighter color, and the lower part is in a darker color. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Blue strips short sleeve shirt Product size Can be customized Product fabric 100% cotton Product style Uniforms Color Customized Logo on t-shirt Embroidery or printing logo as request Samples Free samples for stock Products Feature How to choose a suitable airline captain shirt Choosing a high-quality airline uniform shirt involves considering several factors, including fabric, design, craftsmanship, and fit. Fabric Selection: - Cotton: Cotton is widely regarded as the most skin-friendly option. It feels soft, is non-irritating, and offers good moisture-wicking and breathability. As a natural plant fiber, its softness and comfort are well-recognized. - Wool: Wool shirts are advantageous in winter, providing ample warmth and a certain level of sophistication, making them suitable for commuting and casual settings. - Plaid or Checked Cotton: Typically made from dyed and bleached cotton yarns woven together, these shirts have strong design appeal and are suitable for layering or as outerwear, avoiding a plain appearance. Design Considerations: - Simplify Design Elements: Avoid excessive trendy elements such as cutouts or 3D floral designs, which can make the shirt look overly complicated and hard to pair. - Cautious with Letter Prints: Especially avoid large letters or prominent logos, as these fashion elements can make the shirt appear too casual or street-style, losing its classic appeal. Craftsmanship: - Collar Quality: The collar's stiffness is a key indicator of shirt quality. A high-quality shirt should have a flexible collar stay to keep the collar straight, enhancing the overall appearance and elegance of the shirt. - Button Quality: The choice of buttons is also crucial. High-quality shirts should use premium buttons, avoiding plastic ones to elevate the shirt's overall grade. - Avoid Short Sleeves and Chest Pockets: It is best to avoid shirts with short sleeves or chest pockets. Fit: - Classic Shoulder Fit: A classic shoulder fit is ideal for airline work uniforms, as it conveys a mature and sophisticated look appropriate for formal settings. In summary, selecting a high-quality shirt requires a comprehensive consideration of fabric, design, craftsmanship, and fit to ensure that the shirt is not only stylish but also comfortable and suitable for various occasions. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Hotel uniforms Product size S-5XL (8 sizes)Can be customized Product fabric Polyester Product style Waiter uniforms Color Customized Logo on t-shirt Embroidery or printing logo as request Samples Free samples for stock Products Feature Design Principles and Considerations for Hotel Uniforms The design of hotel uniforms differs from fashion design in that it embodies a combination of practicality and artistry. The approach to design often varies depending on the type of the industry. When designing for hotels, it's important to consider the wearer's environment and job function requirements, emphasizing both distinctiveness and practicality. The design should strike a balance between noticeable differentiation and good uniformity. Hotel uniforms should harmonize with the hotel's regional characteristics. Regardless of the type of hotel, guests will first perceive regional differences and local customs. As a window to the city's or region's image, the hotel should consciously convey local culture and customs through the design of its uniforms, establishing a sense of familiarity with guests. The design process should also consider contemporary fashion trends and international dressing conventions. Uniforms should reflect the hotel's style. In shaping the overall hotel image, uniforms play a crucial role. Modern hotels are no longer just about dining and accommodation; they have expanded to include leisure, entertainment, business, and vacation types, each with diverse styles. As guest needs vary, the design of uniforms must reflect different styles to meet various psychological demands, with the form of the attire being fundamental. Different styles often express different characters and personalities. For example: In vacation or tourist hotels, where guests have strong leisure needs, the design of front desk or dining staff uniforms should be youthful, lively, and reflect leisure, entertainment, and fun. These designs should convey vitality and energy, appearing brisk and dynamic. Elegant styles, typically used for evening wear, embody grace, dignity, and nobility, suitable for mature women and social occasions. Such designs are often used for front desk receptionists or dining staff in vacation hotels. For business hotels, the primary guest requirement is convenience, and everything should reflect efficiency and accuracy. Staff attire should be formal, conservative, with moderate makeup, and of a neutral style. The design should be simple and widely acceptable, without notable age boundaries, appearing plain and unremarkable. Mature styles, characterized by elegant proportions and a youthful yet not childish appearance, often leave a distinguished impression. This design style is suitable for hotel supervisors and above, as well as for staff in public relations, human resources, and finance departments, reflecting the hotel's sense of order and professionalism. details.description: Description Products Description Product number Pilot Shirts And Uniforms Product color Navy blue Fabric composition 69.5% polyester fiber,30.5% viscose fiber Products Feature What does 3 stripes on a pilot mean? The three stripes on a pilot's epaulettes typically do not signify the captain's rank or level in most airline uniform designs. Instead, these stripes are generally associated with the pilot's role or experience. They are often used to distinguish different stages or roles within the cockpit crew, such as cadets, first officers (senior co-pilots), and captains. In most cases, captains wear higher-ranking or specially designated epaulettes to differentiate them from other pilots. The three stripes are more commonly found on the epaulettes of first officers or senior co-pilots. This indicates that they possess sufficient flying experience and skills to assist the captain in operating the aircraft. It is important to note that the specific insignia and meanings of epaulettes can vary between airlines and countries. Therefore, the exact identification and significance of the stripes on a captain's epaulettes can differ depending on the airline or national regulations. The three stripes on an epaulette do not represent a specific rank but rather symbolize a certain level of qualification or responsibility. In a pilot's career progression, the number of stripes typically correlates with their flying experience and range of duties. Epaulettes with three stripes are generally worn by senior first officers (also known as co-pilots or second officers). This indicates that they have acquired professional flying skills and hold a commercial pilot's license issued by aviation authorities, allowing them to operate the aircraft and assist the captain during flights. Thus, three stripes primarily represent the pilot's flying skills and professional competence. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Flight attendant uniform suit(vest+shirt+Skirt) Color Multicolor Fabric Polyester 60.8% Cotton 39.2% Size Can be customized Products Feature When selecting flight attendant uniforms, several key factors must be carefully considered to ensure that the uniform meets functional needs while reflecting the professional image of the crew. 1. Mobility The uniform should be designed to allow a wide range of movement, not restricting the flight attendant's ability to act in emergencies. For example, the uniform should have appropriate elasticity and looseness to enable quick emergency actions, such as evacuating passengers or operating safety equipment. 2. Safety and Protection The uniform must offer fire resistance, abrasion resistance, and scratch resistance to handle various potential hazards in high-altitude environments. Materials should be fire-retardant and tested according to relevant standards to ensure protection in fire or high-temperature situations. Additionally, the design should cover critical body areas to reduce injury risk and consider adding extra protective layers or reinforced areas to enhance overall safety. 3. Attachment for Safety Gear During high-altitude operations, flight attendants may need to use safety harnesses or other protective gear. The uniform design should accommodate this by including features like hooks, loops, or special design areas for safely securing safety gear when needed. 4. Professionalism and Seriousness The design should be simple and dignified, using colors and styles that convey authority and professionalism, such as classic dark tones, neat tailoring, and high-quality fabrics. Uniforms should also clearly display logos and badges for easy identification by passengers. In summary, the design and material selection for flight attendant uniforms must balance functionality and aesthetics, ensuring safety and emergency preparedness while showcasing the professional image and high service standards of the crew. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Captain Security Shirt Color White (color can be customized) Fabric 50% cotton, 50% polyester Style Business Size Can be customized Products Feature How do I identify a dress shirt? When choosing fabric for formal dress shirts, it's important to note that most are made from woven fabrics rather than knit ones. Formal shirts are primarily made from 100% cotton, but may also include natural fibers like silk or wool, or elastane for added stretch. Check the care label to see the fabric composition. Ideally, choose shirts with over 95% cotton content; synthetic fibers are acceptable only if they include elastane. Shirts with added silk, wool, or Tencel often vary by season to improve comfort. The thread count, measured in English system "counts," indicates the fineness of the cotton. Higher numbers mean finer threads and generally higher costs. A thread count of 60 single-ply offers a good texture. Common fabric questions: Is thicker fabric always better? Not necessarily; formal shirts should not be too thick due to their close fit. Is a higher thread count always better? Not always; very high counts, like 330, can be too delicate and difficult to iron. Typically, counts of 140 or 170 are good. Which country produces the best shirt fabrics? China has developed high-quality fabrics over the years. How do Egyptian cotton, Pima cotton, and Xinjiang cotton compare? All are variations of sea island cotton. Egyptian cotton is renowned but less consistent than Pima cotton, which benefits from mechanized farming. Xinjiang cotton is comparable in quality but lacks Pima's consistency. Egyptian cotton, especially Giza45, is highly valued but can have inconsistent quality and availability. Brands using these materials can trace their high-quality origins. details.description: Description Products Description Product name Business shirt Material 40% cotton 60% polyester Collar Square collar Style Standard version Style Business formal Products Feature 01 Skin-friendly and soft.Easy to care for, enjoy a light life, soft and not transparent 02 Reactive printing and dyeing, not easy to shrink/fade.Bright color 03 Stand-up collar.Stand-up collar gives you more confidence and style 04 Carefully selected materials.Long-staple cotton golden ratio fine spinning.No pilling and easy to care for How to choose a suitable airline captain shirt Choosing a high-quality airline uniform shirt involves considering several factors, including fabric, design, craftsmanship, and fit. Fabric Selection: - Cotton: Cotton is widely regarded as the most skin-friendly option. It feels soft, is non-irritating, and offers good moisture-wicking and breathability. As a natural plant fiber, its softness and comfort are well-recognized. - Wool: Wool shirts are advantageous in winter, providing ample warmth and a certain level of sophistication, making them suitable for commuting and casual settings. - Plaid or Checked Cotton: Typically made from dyed and bleached cotton yarns woven together, these shirts have strong design appeal and are suitable for layering or as outerwear, avoiding a plain appearance. Design Considerations: - Simplify Design Elements: Avoid excessive trendy elements such as cutouts or 3D floral designs, which can make the shirt look overly complicated and hard to pair. - Cautious with Letter Prints: Especially avoid large letters or prominent logos, as these fashion elements can make the shirt appear too casual or street-style, losing its classic appeal. Craftsmanship: - Collar Quality: The collar's stiffness is a key indicator of shirt quality. A high-quality shirt should have a flexible collar stay to keep the collar straight, enhancing the overall appearance and elegance of the shirt. - Button Quality: The choice of buttons is also crucial. High-quality shirts should use premium buttons, avoiding plastic ones to elevate the shirt's overall grade. - Avoid Short Sleeves and Chest Pockets: It is best to avoid shirts with short sleeves or chest pockets. Fit: - Classic Shoulder Fit: A classic shoulder fit is ideal for airline work uniforms, as it conveys a mature and sophisticated look appropriate for formal settings. In summary, selecting a high-quality shirt requires a comprehensive consideration of fabric, design, craftsmanship, and fit to ensure that the shirt is not only stylish but also comfortable and suitable for various occasions.
